Reviews.Title: “Groupon deal, dinner bed and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: CathandAl
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at the Ramada for just one night.. We found the staff friendly and the room clean and pleasant. I was so looking forward to our three course dinner, however the laminated poor choice of menu and the plasic table cloths left me feeling a little disapointed. Even the sauses were presented in saches that i would expect from a cafe rather than a restaurant. I found my food to be the worst i've had in many a year from the over seasoned fowl tasting broccoli soup, to the steak pie that i struggled to find one tiny peice of meat in (it should have been called beef flavoured shortcrust) to the freezer burnt lemon tart. Of course when asked about our stay i simply said 'fine thankyou' in my usual fashion. I'm sorry Ramada.. i should have been honest and maybe standards would improve .

Reviews.Title: “Groupon purchaser”
Reviews.Author: Lovestotravel123456
Reviews.Content: We went on a Groupon deal - I don't think we were treated in a different manner because of this. The staff did seem very friendly and polite. Room was ok but definitely wasn't nice enough to serve as a romantic mini break as I had hoped - it was more functional than special. Better than a travelodge but if I had paid the full price as was advertised I would have been extremely unhappy!! We enjoyed most of the food, but the dinner choice was rather limited and the goat's cheese tart starter was of extremely poor quality. The breakfast was much better - really good actually, which lots of choice, constant topping up of coffee and tea and we were not rushed at all. Lovely hot full English, continental fare, fresh bread, fresh fruit, cereals etc - constantly being topped up. Nice view from the room and very short walk from tube station.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied with our stay”
Reviews.Author: pbb_2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a 2 for 1 Winter Break offer and was a little wary due to some of the other reviews posted on here. However I can only go on what we experienced during our stay, which was: excellent value and a very good hotel to stay at. The Room was fine (we asked when booking for a quiet room) on the mezzanine floor. The food was excellent, especially the Dinner included with the deal, and Breakfast was very good too. The staff were very helpful and nothing like some other people have commented (maybe they are no longer there!). The hotel wasn’t particularly busy so that might be a contributory reason. The location is very good with Hyde Park opposite, Notting Hill just around the corner and Bayswater itself a very nice and safe environment. Buses run to the west End on a regular basis and there are plenty of Tube Stations in the area. All in all a very good value stay and will stay there again when in London – especially when there are similar offers.

Reviews.Title: “if this is a real 4 star hotel ..there must be good hotels with 10 stars”
Reviews.Author: LPRUST
Reviews.Content: Rooms are out of date , Bathrooms clean but urgently need to be redone. Internet from the 80 ties. Pub food is always better than their breakfast ,coffee served at the breakfast undrinkable... Never ever will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: terry_riley1
Reviews.Content: I recently booked a winter deal consisting of 2 nights bed and breakfast with evening meal on the first night.Hotel very close to Queensway and Bayswater underground stations. Booking in very good staff very helpful. Stayed in room 701 overlooking Hyde Park. Coach park opposite but minor distraction. Room a bit dated but clean and fair size and surprisingly quiet as next to a very busy road. Evening meal very good but be warned wine starts about Â£18 a bottle. Staff very attentive. Bed very comfortable and breakfast very good. Overall an excellent weekend. Pity about the drink prices but I suppose you have to take into account it's London.

Reviews.Title: “Old, tired, bad food, dirty cutlery, shower was ok if your 5ft! Room 301!Group on deal was not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: Jpfg
Reviews.Content: Old, tired, bad food, dirty cutlery, shower was ok if your 5ft! Room 301! Group on deal was not worth the money. Terrible value for money! You have to pay for Wifi! Parking was Â£35 + Â£20 congestion charge. Do not stay here as it will be a missive disappointment!

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, hotel OK apart from dinner”
Reviews.Author: Don W
Reviews.Content: The location is brilliant, with Hyde Park just across the road (best explored by 'Boris Bike') and excellent restaurants etc. in Notting Hill Gate a few yards the other way. Also red buses into town and sightseeing buses at the door - tube a few minutes walk. Room and general facilities were OK - except that the TV was very hard to work, and never got Radio 4 properly in spite of repeated complaints to the Concierge. Dinner was very disappointing - ghastly tasteless soup, and the rest mediocre and institutional. Prices are ridiculous for food of such poor quality - we had one dinner there because it was included in our deal. Breakfast was a pleasant surprise - standard stuff on a buffet, but well cooked and plentiful and served until quite late - 12:00 on Sunday. Overall, our Â£150 2-night package was very good value. But eat out - there are good places a few yards away!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: FlikandCoco
Reviews.Content: My husband & I were booked in to this hotel by his work, it is not somewhere I would choose to stay. I found the hotel a little disappointing, the room was tired & dated, with marks on the wall, the bath had rust patches and there was mould on the pelmet - didn't look like it had been wiped/washed at all. The staff however, I found to be helpful, friendly & check in/out fast. The breakfast was ok with a good selection on offer including a full English, pastries and cereal.

Reviews.Title: “Groupon Voucher”
Reviews.Author: hmblack
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed here in February 2012 after purchasing a groupon for a 1 night stay including breakfast and an evening meal. We decided to add on an extra two nights so stayed 3 nights in total. We both work in hotels so are very aware of the industry and have to say that the location and room were both very good, Handy for the tube, very nice area overlooking Hyde Park and Kensington Gardens. The room was a good size, everything you needed was there! Reception staff and concierge were very welcoming and accomodating. My big problem with the hotel was the food! We only dined in the hotel as it was included in the voucher. The evening meal has to be the worse meal I have ever had. Slow service, processed, dry food. It was the shame with breakfast the next morning - dirty tables, poor selection... I would stay at this hotel again but only if I got a good room only rate!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Jill P
Reviews.Content: The whole stay was generally disappointng. The rooms were very dated and tired. Our room had pen marks on the walls and the shower curtains. The bath was rusted, and the paint work chipped! At dinner, the tables were dirty, our cutlery and wine glasses actually stuck to the table. At breakfast I thought the staff (who were over worked) wanted to kill us whenever we asked for something like a cup of tea. Everything was just hard work, and not what is needed for a relaxing break. I would not return.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel for central london”
Reviews.Author: tinman1uk2010
Reviews.Content: writting this on the two night stay deal booked with evening meal and breakfast for Â£159 first impression of the hotel was nice speedy check in room on the 5th floor over looking the back heating in the room adequate nice to see rooms with both radiator and an air con unit by the window queensway is just a short walk or if feeling energetic could walk to paddington 15-20 mins no problems with the overall room size does the job good bathroom bath and shower bed could be more comfortable but saying that i am used to my own memory foam bed perhaps this could be concidered in future the general decor of the rooms could need updating can not say anything about the evening meal as we are having this tonight but the breakfast is well worth it waitresses come to the tables with as much tea/coffee as you like all the usual items both cereal and cooked in ample supply for couples out there would highly recommend the dove spa there are a few around london if you want to treat yourself or your partner came to see the show GHOST not exactly my cup of tea but she enjoyed it playing at the piccadilly theatre

Reviews.Title: “Better available nearby”
Reviews.Author: Tenacious_Doug
Reviews.Content: I normal stay at the nearby Corus but gave the ramada a try when it was full. It took 3 attempts to get a room, the first being single rather than the double I booked, next one had somebody in it already, they then upgraded me to a better room which was nice and spacious but stank of smoke, but by that point I couldn't be bothered changing again. In the morning the fire alarm went off and the reception printer broke meaning I couldn't get an invoice until several days later, both frustrating but fitting end to a haphazard stay.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel ..”
Reviews.Author: bloggs19
Reviews.Content: having stayed in some rather awful hotels over the past six months the Ramada Jarvis Hyde park always has me coming back. Clean, decent sized rooms, competitive prices ( if you book early ) and friendly staff most certainly recommend

Reviews.Title: “recent stay”
Reviews.Author: SHAGGYWOODY
Reviews.Content: We have just had a two night stay at this hotel which as everyone says is in a great location. Right opposite Hyde Park and around the corner from Queensway tube station and also a 5 minute bus ride into Oxford Street and the West End. We had a deal with evening meal on the first night and breakfast. The evening meal was very disappointing and needs a new chef and definately improving. However the breakfast was one of the best I have ever had at a hotel. Fresh fruit, yeo valley yoghurts, a full range of cereals, toast, mini pastries, cheeses and hams and a full well cooked english breakfast. Delicious. We had a room at the front on the main road which let in a lot of sunlight. Rooms are equipped with tea and coffee, water (replaced daily), a proper hairdryer and an iron and ironing board in cupboard. Also fresh towels in cupboard if you need new ones. The bed was very clean and extremelly comfortable and although you could hear the traffic you are in London and it is a busy city...what do you expect!!! Slept really well. They have the new Boris bikes just across the road in Hyde Park which we used to have a ride around the park and vicinity. Very enjoyable. Also walking access to Exhibition road where the museums are. We would definately come back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Suprised”
Reviews.Author: nagsSuffolkUK
Reviews.Content: I needed to be in London for one night, so I took up a Groupon voucher offer, and booked this hotel for bed and breakfast with a 3 course dinner for two people thrown in with the price. The trip advisor reviews had not been that good, so I was not expecting too much for my money. I knew the location of the hotel well, and was aware that it was in a great location for visitors to the city. Checking in was speedy and efficient, the staff were pleasant and helpful. The room was as good size, clean and comfortable. Our room was on the ground floor and overlooked an alley, so we had a peaceful night's sleep in comfortable beds. The evening meal was no better than average, but, as it was in with the booking price, I was quite happy with it. The restaurant was a pleasant space and the staff were excellent. Breakfast was very good indeed, and even though the breakfast room was busy, there were plenty of staff on duty to help. If I can get a similar price, or even the same price without dinner, I would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “location ok but...”
Reviews.Author: xander
Reviews.Content: very noisy inside (doors really need soft closing mechanism) & outside (windows only appeared to be single glazed) traffic & pedestrian noise woke us several times during the night so take your ear plugs! had a problem with the bedding which was sorted quickly, bathroom small & compact with a dirty bath. Restaurant,good full english breakfast buffet, cereal, fruit & croissants, evening dinner just ok nothing to shout about! plenty of restaurants around the hotel. The big rubbish bus tour(ashamed to be english) picks up right in front of hotel, attractions with-in 15-25 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Old Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: paulAmersfoort
Reviews.Content: Best about this hotel is the location, just at kensington Gardens and Hyde Park. In the neighbourhood are enough little restaurants for dining or breakfast, and the underground is nearby. The hotel itself is old and tired. Rooms are clean, but bathrooms are very small and everuthing needs to be repainted etc. comfi beds!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel. Welcoming atmosphere (decor needs a bit of colour though).”
Reviews.Author: Sparkey23
Reviews.Content: Myself, husband & little girl stayed during Half Term week on a Groupon deal (DBB). Hotel is just a few minutes walk from Queensway tube & opposite to Hyde Park/Kensington Gdns, so excellent location. Room was bigger than expected (for a London hotel). We had twin room with sofa made up for my daughter. Very good facilites-they even had a special section for drying hair with mirror, away from desk-very useful! We were on 5th floor overlooking coach park by the Park. Dinner & service was good & very attentive lady in the dining room. However, had to pay full price for an adult meal for my little girl as had no childrens' menu!! (yet found later in room directory that they do Room Service with a children's menu-where is the logic in that!). Breakfast had a wide choice & was nice quality. The decor everywhere was shades of beige, I did not see any other color- the atmosphere of the hotel, although good, would be greatly improved by a more varied colour scheme! To summarise: a good hotel, nothing exceptional, but would stay here again. PS-Hop on/hop off tour buses stop directly outside of the front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unhygienic. Awful dinner, but amazing breakfast. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: ICanGrowPeople
Reviews.Content: My sister bought a Groupon offer for us both and we only stayed for one night on Feb 13th. We stayed on the 4th floor and in a twin room. View was of the back/alley, but wasn't bad. The thing we noticed straight away was the strong smell of urine coming from the bathroom. There is no way to air the bathroom, no windows or fan so it just stank the whole time. My sister had a closer look and it seemed to be the shower curtain! Ewwww. We spent most of the time out of the hotel in fact we only just got there in time to check in at 6.45pm and was scheduled to have our free dinner in the brasserie at 7pm. Note:- you should NOT eat here for dinner. But if you must, and it was free which was the only reason we ate there that night, book your table time in advance, I.e. the day you book your stay! When we checked in, the lady on the desk told us of we hadn't have booked our time ahead, the soonest we could eat would have been 8.30pm! About the dinner. Where to start. The staff, In particular, Reba, practically threw plates of food down, no eye contact, no manners, no converstion whatsoever. I asked for mayo, a different fork (my sisters was sticky -ewww), and the eye rolls that came with it. Wow. Things seemed like too much trouble for some of the staff on the dinner shift. The main thing about the dinner was the lack of hygiene. I am pregnant, so it's even more important I don't get food poisoning or such like. I watched, and their method of cleaning their tables between sittings, was a tea towel. Dry. Vaguely wiping crumbs off. No cleaning spray, no nothing! I was quite shocked. No wonder the table was sticky! The breakfast however, was a TOTALLY different experience! The food was fresh and amazing service. The hygiene still lacked, but after such an awful dinner, breakfast was a total shock. All you can eat of everything! The next morning, after quite a comfy bed to sleep in, we checked out. The kind man asked us how it was and we couldn't lie. But to be honest we didn't lay in to them. We just said it in a nice way, and he assured us he was going to address these issues or how else would they improve? Fair point. And he also, refunded us Â£40! We didn't ask for that so was very happy. I think I would stay here again, but definitely won't be eating dinner in the brasserie! location is good only a very short walk from the Queensway tube station.

Reviews.Title: “Rather disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Sue G
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on 11 February. It was a Groupon offer, so we weren't expecting the best room. In fact, the room itself was fine, except that it was very cold. I woke several times in the night because the heating just wasn't enough. Our television would only show films - TV channels just wouldn't work at all. A member of staff came to look and said that he had no idea why it was like that, but that we could have the film channel free of charge. Well, the choice of films was terrible; there was just nothing interesting at all. Even the "adult" channel was no more than school-kid porn! This was all a real pity because the evening meal was included in the offer so we didn't want to eat out, but there was no room in the restaurant so we had to have our meal in our room. It all felt pretty dismal. Other disappointments were small - only 4 milk cartons (yes, I know we could have asked for more, but after having to ring for room service because the restaurant was full, and then having a member of staff trying for ages to fix the television, we just didn't feel like ringing down again); only one little packet of biscuits between two of us (mean, or what?!), and then an aged failing toaster in the breakfast room which necessitated putting each slice of bread through 3 times and therefore causing a very long queue). Otherwise, all was well - the food that was brought to our room was delicious and the staff were all very polite.

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL OK BUT FOOD WAS A JOKE!”
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the 18th Feb on a groupon offer which consisted of a double room, 3 course meal and breakfast. Got to the hotel late afternoon and attempted to book dinner only to be told we could either eat in half an hour in the restaurant or come back later to eat in the bar area, which wasn't the end of the world but in hindsight I wish I had told them we didn't want dinner as it was probably the worse meal I have ever had at a hotel. The soup was below room temp, the pie was tastless, mash was more like smash and dessert was disgusting, I am only glad that I didn't have to pay their extortionate prices for the food (though I did have too for a beer and glass of wine). Breakfast was not better, service a joke, scrambled egg which was the strangest tasting I have ever experiance, dirty knives on the floor it was not great. Other than that the room was ok, nothing special, staff helpful and location good but next time I'll book a B&B and go out for a decent meal.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: sarahjane47
Reviews.Content: I stayed here just for the one night in a single room using a special offer c/o Booking.com. Some of the other reviews have not been that good so i was slightly apprehensive and not expecting much for my Â£49 single room. The room turned out to be perfect with everything I needed..bathroom with a bath, coffee and tea making facilities, TV and radio and even an ironing board. There was also enough space to do my pilates exercises..unusual for any hotel single room. I had a great nights sleep ( no noise whatsoever in my side facing room) and left with my blouse freshly pressed for an important meeting. It's a bonus being able to get some exercise in Hyde Park and Queensway is a breath of fresh air compared to the rest of London. I will stay here every time i visit London now.

Reviews.Title: “Great location however hotel needs updating.”
Reviews.Author: Marsden72
Reviews.Content: Great location next to Queenswater Tube Station and central to great shops, eateries and restaurants. The hotel is good however a bit out of touch in 2012 - no fridge in room, no wifi in room. Not everyone has a laptop. Ipdad/ iPhone ? Beds need refurbed as they were more like water beds. Bath smelled and the towels were dirty. Ironing board is the mini one attached to a trouser press. TV reception was bad. Room size was good however bathroom was very small. If you are looking for average Rooms with decent price in a great location then this is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Angela5656
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the ramada Hyde park in January 2012 for two nights for a business trip. The lobby was small but there was free wifi .However , the rooms did not have free wifi.However , some of the rooms closer to the lobby were able to ride on that. I know because I inadvertently discovered that. The room I had was reasonably big compared to a lot of twin rooms that I had stayed in before(4 star business type hotels).It surprisingly also had tea making facilities if I am not wrong. The minuses if the room was mine was facing the road and it can be quite noisy when traffic is heavy.The bathroom had a tub that had seen better days; the paint was scraped off. For an Asian like myself the hotel location was excellent as the bays water Asian eateries were just around the corner where queens way tube station is . In particular , mandarin kitchen , famous for its lobster noodles is jus a hop and skip away. Lastly, I wish to commend the reception staff who were extremely helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Don't eat there!!!”
Reviews.Author: jane l
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight 11th Feb on a groupon offer. The room was comfortable except too cold (given that there was snow on the ground outside!). Radiator couldn't cope at full heat. Staff very helpful but all they could do was give us extra pillows and duvets which we used to try to block the cold coming in through the (inadequate) windows. Our biggest issue was with the brasserie- ate there as it was included in the offer. Food was inedible!! Goats cheese so cremated it could be anything, veg lasagne I am sure had been frozen and defrosted, horrid taste and about four pieces of anaemic veg. My husbands soup (meant to be "vegetable" but could ahve been anything!!) and pie and mash equally bad. Go out- plenty of restaurants in the area!!!

Reviews.Title: “Smokers Room”
Reviews.Author: My2cents-adviser
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over a Saturday night on 6th February using a Groupon offer. My main disappointment was that we were given a smokers room. It stank of cold cigar and cigarette smell. I asked to be moved to a non-smoking room but they were fully booked. We were given an air freshner spray which I sprayed at least 5 times on the soft furnishings to get rid of the smell. When I unpacked at home all my clothes smelt of smoke. The hotel said that it was the last room available, however at the time of booking they never asked whether I wanted smoking or non. Evening meal was OK - Bernie Inn style. The breakfast was again OK, although there was plenty of choice. We were asked for an imprint of our card upon checking in and then later in the evening when we bought drinks we had to pay cash and couldn't put them on our card!! Good position, staff attentive in the restaurant but the room really spoilt our weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, if you can afford it!”
Reviews.Author: vtyeah
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here on 6th February and had a decent stay. We both agreed the beds were really comfortable and we slept very well even though the hotel is near the road. The Twin room was a good size, with tea making facilities and a bottle of water. Breakfast was good, the fried breakfast was nothing special but they did offer chocolate muffins, which I thought was a nice touch! The room cost Â£260 which I think is far too high for what was just an o.k hotel. I think you are paying for the location. I found the staff at reception friendly and we were able to check out at 1pm which was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast a rip off!”
Reviews.Author: lanaboyle
Reviews.Content: Hairdryer was excellent as was storage space and lots of hangers. Breakfast was extremely overpriced. We had breakfast both mornings and were charged a staggering 62 pound for the pleasure! Breakfast consited of for me on the second morning, some bacon and beans and one glass of orange juice. I didn't have tea or coffee or toast as there was no bread. I feel to be charged 15 pound for this is outrageous. We also eat in the restaurant and their burger is priced at 14 pound! 14 pound for a frozen burger!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good service”
Reviews.Author: RobIpswich
Reviews.Content: Just a couple of minutes walk from Queensway underground station, with several bus routes stopping nearby - and - useful for tourists, London sightseeing buses stop right outside teh hotel. Check in handled swiftly and efficiently, room on the 6th floor overlooking Hyde Park was adequate in size. Some minor repairs should have been done to the room, including replacing torn wallpaper - not acceptable in a four star establishment. As usual, rates through on line booking sites substantially cheaper than turning up at the hotel. Breakfast good quality although the kitchen seemed a bit pressed to keep up with demand for hot items. Breakfast if booked in advance Â£10, if pay on the day Â£15.50

Reviews.Title: “Overall, great hotel for our needs!”
Reviews.Author: bjreimann
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in January 2012. I expected the rooms to be small and they were, but they were clean and well kept. We had an included breakfast which we thought was excellent - we really enjoyed it! The hotel was in a great location with the park for exercising right across the street, shops and restaurants nearby and bus and train station within a short walk. The only downside was that the elevator kept breaking (one was broke for 2 of our 4 days) and the walls are very thin - I could hear the guy in the room next to me snoring very clearly!! Overall, I would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A real let down”
Reviews.Author: Adam212
Reviews.Content: At check in, we were told that our booking isnt on there system, having booked through booking.com i showed them confirmation but they still suggested we hadnt booked a room. Then i was told i booked February instead of January which is a total lie as i had confirmation in my hand that stated my stay was for January. Staff trying to shift blame on to us before we even checked in. Room very small and a bit dated. poor experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “Attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: KJMarshall
Reviews.Content: Our stay was for two nights with breakfast and an evening meal inculuded. The staff were very attentive and we had a few requests which they fulfilled. The room was very clean and the bathroom was lovely. The meal was of a good quality. The breakfast had a good range of choices with the staff again being helpful. The hotel looked after our bags for 10 hours after we checked out and had no problem in doing so. The location of the hotel was ideal for us opposite Hyde Park and up from Notting Hill. I would stay here again and I would reccomend it also.

Reviews.Title: “Miserable Stay Due To Hotel Staff”
Reviews.Author: manibainz
Reviews.Content: It is a nice hotel and location is spot on, a two min walk from Queensway station. Booked 2 nights via their own wesbite and they had a special offer on which included breakfast and a meal for the first night, paid Â£77 per night. Check in was nice quick and the receptionist booked us in the restauarant for the dinner and room was spacious and had the relevant things i.e hair dryer, iron, ironing board, tea, coffee, biscuits, towels etc. Anyway after me and my partner enjoyed the free meal we was chased by the waitress in the hotel restaurant demanding that we pay the bill, and didnt seem to understand when I explained to her about the offer, and after the receptionist checked this on the system she was satisfied. No apology was offered for the embarassment caused as this happened in front view of other guests. THIS IS UNACCEPTABLE. And than when we ordered room service on the 2nd night, the guy who brought up the food automatically assumed that we would tip him the Â£5.60 change that was owed to us, and we had TO CALL AND ASK FOR THE CHANGE BACK! This is the first time this has ever happened to us, normally we do tip the staff but to assume that you will automatically get a tip is just down right rude! Than whilst we rang through reception for a taxi, it wasnt clearly explained that we had to come down wait in the freezing cold while the concerige attempted to hail down a black cab. And than on check out was told we had to pay Â£10 for the meal as we had gone over the budget, again the terms and conditions of the offer wasnt made clear, and I feel that the staff have no relevant training and really lack customer service, all the staff are foreign and at time struggled to understand me and vice versa. At least the breakfast was nice, I would not go back to the hotel just for the simple fact that the attitude of the staff lacks quality.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for one night”
Reviews.Author: Beaulygirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived for only one night using a Groupon voucher which included dinner. We were pleased with what we got considering the very good deal we paid for, but had we paid the full rack rate price, I would have been sorely dissapointed. The rooms are clean but basic, with mattress protectors too small for the beds so you can see the striped mattress through the thin sheet. The pillows were pretty useless also but again, they were only for one night. Dinner didn't start off well as they had sold out of quite a few dishes, along with the lamb which they waited for 40 minutes before telling me, but I was quite impressed with the food once it came! Lovely steak and tasty ham hock terrine for starter! I would stay there again as it was so convenient due to it's location, but only if I had another voucher deal.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed :)”
Reviews.Author: Sian B
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night just after Christmas with family and my boyfriend. Got a good offer online so not in a position to judge to hotel based upon its standard rates. The room was very big and the bed was even bigger FANTASTIC. Rooms were clean and warm with fresh towels, toiletries and free tea and coffee. The hotel bar was cozy but very pricey, but then again it is London. Wish I could of stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Price driven but that's just not enough”
Reviews.Author: arthurh
Reviews.Content: Most of the reviews of this hotel focus on the cheapness and value for money and that's why I booked, a last minute trip to London and my usual hotel was full, this seemed like a good cheap option. Initial views were that i had got it nearly right, room was ok, bathroom seemed ok, public areas tired but ok, check in was very slow. However most people, myself included, book hotels in order to get some sleep. If you don't or can't do that any perception of value is completely lost, even if it was Â£1 a night it would be too expensive and that was exactly my experience. The room was exceptionally cold throughout the night, a notice said that if the room wasnt warm enough use the thermostat on the radiator, there wasn't one. More importantly it was incredibly noisy, with some heat pump or fans running all night, creating a very broken nights sleep. Logically I should have complained at the time and asked for a change in room, but am sure everyone has been in that situation where case is unpacked, come back from a meal out and get into bed, it's just easier to get head down and hope it will stop, it didn't! Maybe it was just this room, 315, and if the management deal with my complaint in a fitting manner I would stay again in a different room to give it another chance. If the problems, heat and noise, do only affect that room, this hotel would be superb value at the price I paid. Hopefully I will report back!!

Reviews.Title: “what a tired hotel!”
Reviews.Author: david s
Reviews.Content: what a tired hotel, first room the bath had painted bottom to hide chips and the room was very tired,upgraded to a suite which had a chipped bath and again a strange painted bottom which hid a chipped bath bottom, dirty windows with hand marks all over and dirty silicone around bath!. went to show returned and no heating so a portable heater was brought to our room. upgraded again to another suite, this is the worst hotel we have stayed at and we stay in a lot of hotels.had a meal in the brasserie and it was very cold in there but food was ok.how this has a four aa star is beyond us.overall dirty and tired,,, not recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great location, no frills”
Reviews.Author: freedom0957
Reviews.Content: We booked one night with breakfast and evening meal, taking advantage of a Groupon offer. We were delighted with the result: nice clean room, small but functional bathroom. Efficiently booked in, good service at dinner, decent food and very good breakfast. 5 minutes from tube station and opposite the park. I probably would not be so happy if I had to pay the full price, but absolutely perfect on offer.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Richard H
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel often and always find it top notch. I think it's best feature is the staff who always go out of their way to assist you. They have had the same night manager and general manager for years and a very loyal group of people who run the hotel with expertise. The elaborate breakfast is much more comprehensive and has many more choices than the generic items that are laid out at most hotels for guests. There is a real effort made here. The Notting Hill Gate location is near everything. One can't go wrong with this hotel! Richard Harte

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, only”
Reviews.Author: jk0819
Reviews.Content: Bought the Groupon offer so we didn't expect we would get the best room. We were sent to 7th floor, the view of the room were nice though the room itself was a bit disappointed. Standard size but the cleanliness of bathroom was a bit let down. When the room getting too warm in the night, we turned off the heater and turned on the air conditioner, the air came out from that A/C, oh God, it stinks! So we turned off everything and left the window opened, then the wind was bashing the window (it's 7th floor)! But we took that as overall, we kept thinking it's a Groupon offer, you can't ask for too much. Food - another let down. The dinner included in the Groupon turned out either a 3-course menu worth Â£15 or any selection on the A la-Cart for not more than Â£25. Of course, drinks were not included. We were struggling on choosing between either the menu as we didn't think the food including the room together as they promoted worth Â£300. We saw another couple also using the Groupon voucher but they chose to leave and skipped the dinner at the hotel as plenty of restaurants were just around the corner. Obviously we were not the only pair disappointed by the offer. Breakfast - probably the only thing that reach the standard - standard hotel English buffet breakfast. Overall, we felt we purchased the Groupon for the location only, nothing else.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: kevr39
Reviews.Content: Located halfway between Notting Hill Gate and Queensway tube stations, it's on a busy road with traffic going by from early morning until late at night. There are a lots of restaurants, shops, ATMs within easy walking distance and Kensington Gardens/Hyde Park is just opposite. The room I had was nothing spectacular but was clean and comfortable though could do with a bit of updating, especially the poorly fitting aliminium windows. Luckily my room overlooked the side/rear of the hotel so I wasn't disturbed by the traffic noise. The restaurant and bar was quite comfortable though meals were a bit expensive. The service I received was friendly and prompt so no complaints there. The hotel was busy and seems well used by tourists and business people alike, I'm not sure I'd stay if I had to pay myself unless I got a good price it was Â£100 per night with corporate discount when I stayed.

Reviews.Title: “No frills...period. Definitely for the independent traveler.”
Reviews.Author: natinmd
Reviews.Content: This hotel is for a traveler who simply wants shelter and a "relatively" clean place to stay. The hotel could definitely use some upgrades...sheets were a bit worn and there was hair in the room upon our check in that did not belong to myself or my fiancÃ©. However, we decided to make the best of it. The room had a strange sanitized perfumey scent that I noticed for the first several days of our stay. The hotel staff was average at performing their basic duties. The restaurant staff was a little better than average. The stay came with free breakfast each morning...stick with the toast, coffee, and cheeses...I will not complain because it was free. The hotel offered free wi-fi in the lobby... I believe it was about 20 pounds a day for usage in the room. The good things about the hotel. LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION. I am not sure what the daily price is for a room, we got this as a package deal, however it was nicely centered around many London landmarks... across from Hyde Park, within walking distance of Harrods and several museums; Natural History, Science, Victoria and Albert (about 20-30 minute walk), it is about 15 minute (15 pound) taxi ride to the city OR you can hop on the bus which takes a bit a longer but gives you an inexpensive tour of the city ( a few pounds round trip), the stop is one street over from the hotel. You are pretty much in the Notting Hill area if you stay here. There are several drug stores, a mall, restaurants, street shopping, and take away within walking distance of the hotel. The tube station is about a 5 minute walk away from the hotel. So if you are all about location for a London stay this is your hotel. If you want to be pampered, stay in a pristinely clean room, with fluffy pillows, extra towels, cable, a comfortable bed and stellar service I suggest looking around a bit. Would I stay here again? I am not sure yet...

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Travelin10ACgurl
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at this hotel. It is in a great location. Close to a tube station. Lots of restaurants around. You can be anywhere in the city in a few tube stops. Our room was a little small for three people, but the beds were comfortable and the staff friendly. The breakfast buffet was excellent. We did eat in the hotel restaurant one night and it was great, too. Good neighborhood to stay in. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: so s
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel for 4 nights, and I would recommand this hotel because of many advantages : - clean rooms - very helpful staff - big rooms (comparing with the size of most london hotels rooms) -fair price -mini-bar -iron + ironing table -hair dryer - comfortable beds - very good location (opposite of hyde park parking) - we leave our luggage for hours in the check-out day _free disadvantages: - no safty box - the doors wood scratches

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, small, old rooms, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ConVivo
Reviews.Content: When I say, "small" rooms, these are more accurately described as "bread box-like" in size. Micro is another word I would use. The rooms were also very old looking with peeling wall paper, AC and heat that "fought with each other, single pane glass so the cols was always coming through the windows. The beds were obsolete and numb-back inducing pain. The staff was superb in all interactions and the location between Queensgate and Knottinghill Gate tube stations made for very easy travel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value Hotel in London”
Reviews.Author: GreatGTraveller
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a 4 star quality hotel located conveniently in London and at a price that does not burn your pocket, this is definitely an excellent choice. The rooms are of decent size, equipped with a 32 LCD tv and the normal standard facilities. Having complimentary biscuit and 2 bottles of water is a nice touch. Within 5-8 minutes walk, you can reach 3 tube stations - Notting Hill, Queensway and Bayswater. In fact, I even walked to the Paddington station which is a manageable 15 minutes. Food and convenience stores are aplenty near Bayswater. Opposite the hotel is the Hyde Park. With a promotional rate I got for 79Â£ a night with full hot buffet breakfast, this must be among the best value hotel you can find in London!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in good location.”
Reviews.Author: hozzie
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 1 night to attend a training course in central London. The hotel is situated in an ideal location, with a 2 minute walk to the Queensway tube station. Bayswater tube station is also very close. The hotel is clean and staff are very friendly. The hotel seems a bit dated and the rooms are small, but it has everything you need for a short stay. The air conditioned room was a bonus. Breakfast was good, with a decent selection available. Internet was chargeable which was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad........”
Reviews.Author: Paxosconcierge
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nts late nov, great location, less than 3 mins walk from queensway tube on central line, room ever so slightly tired and our shower was diabolical but great breakfast and staff friendly enough, would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel! Excellent location!!!”
Reviews.Author: TEYWEY
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel while I was in London. Not only it is very clean, but the staff were awesome!!! They even checked me in at 11am, no extra cost! Thank you to Deepak, the concierge guy from Hungary and of course the restaurant staff Joylene who made eating my breakfast alone extra special! Thank you! Will definitely stay here again. The location was awesome! So accessible! Its better to take the bus to Oxford Circus than the tube and cheaper than a taxi because it is faster as buses have their own lanes.

Reviews.Title: “What do people expect?!”
Reviews.Author: happyholiday54
Reviews.Content: This hotel is immaculately clean, the staff could not be friendlier or more helpful. The breakfast is fresh and plentiful and runs for a number of hours over the weekend, location is ideal for all London attractions with public transport at your finger tips yet situated out of the hustle and bustle. I travelled to meet friends and family and not one had any problems or complaints...I really do wonder what people expect for thier money when I read some of the other reviews here. My only one point would be that their should be free wi-fi available in the bedrooms, this is a minor point though. This is 4 star at very competative prices, if people require 5 star then they need to pay more to expect that in the Capital.

Reviews.Title: “Terribly noisy and bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne O
Reviews.Content: I Stayed in the hotel for 2 nights in November in a twin room with my mum. I have stayed in other Wyndham hotels and this was quite disappointing. The reception is beautiful but the rooms are old. I was put in a room next to the pantry on the 5th floor, and it was impossible to have a lie in. The cleaners were up and down the corridor from 7am till I went out at noon, when I called to complain at reception. The guy at the reception was rude and didn't offer to change my room, he just said, I will tell them to be quiet when closing the door which obviously didn't happen. Then the last straw, was when I was checking out, I was told I had breakfast which I certainly didn't and when they checked their systems properly it was verified. It would have been a wonderful stay because the location is excellent but the staff certainly need to improve their customer service. Yvonne

Reviews.Title: “Take notice this is a GREAT Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ian F
Reviews.Content: I searched the internet and London hotel prices were very high probably because of the lead-up to Christmas - then I came across the Ramada at Hyde Park. I took a chance and my wife and I had three great nights there. Good room - good food - great staff - quiet yet on a busy main road - well placed for the cheap buses into London West End (Â£2.20 each way). Could not fault this hotel in any way and for the price is was a steal!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Lisa O
Reviews.Content: A group of friends used this hotel for a weekend away and found it a very useful location to get around London. We were all on a budget so from that point of view, good value for the money paid, we paid Â£137 per night per twin room. We were on the 5th floor, and room was very clean and tidy and really had everything you needed. Bathrooms were very clean and tidy, could have done with a bit more water pressure, but most hotels have this problem. Atleast you had proper bath towel sizes, really big bath sheets, so would fit a large man quite well. Not a luxury level, but then you are not paying luxury prices. As a base to explore London, excellent. Right across the road from Hyde |Park and Kensington Gardens, just as said. Bus stops right outside hotel entrance and a literal 2 minute walk from Queensway tube station. Yes, hotel could do with a facelift, all staff were very helpful and pleasant. We had the set menu in the restaurant on our first night, excellent food and good value. The staff were all foreign, but did their best. Woluld I stay here again, most definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Shreyance
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel for 2 nights. The best part about this hotel is the location, very central and easy to reach from Heathrow (by Airport Express to Paddington and then a short cab ride). The hotel is quite old and it is evident from the rooms and the lobby. The rooms are very small and just about fits 2 adults. But, i guess that is the case of all budget hotels in Central London. It is VFM, so would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: paulguitar
Reviews.Content: Second time we've stayed in this hotel. Location is excellent, staff are very polite and helpful, the room was large for London and very comfortable.Will definately go back

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: baron777red
Reviews.Content: stayed at the ramada hyde park for 1 night in november, and i cant fault the hotel, excellent service, the room was clean and comfortable, and there was even an iron and trouser press which cam in handy, had dinner at 8.30 and the staff were excellent, and the food was nice too, drinks were a little expensive, Â£9.20 for a pint of guinness and small white wine, but its to be expected for a hotel in central london. we also had breakfast in the morning which was buffet style and this was lovely, there was a vey good choice of food, we dont normally stay in a 4 star, but it was special treat for my wife and it did not dissapoint. the location was good in between nottinghill gate and queensway, with the latter being the station we used, it was literally 2-3 mins walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good couple of days in London”
Reviews.Author: holiday096
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be in a good location (especially for people like us with bus passes), it was clean and well presented, the breakfast was excellent and the staff were very welcoming and helpful. Some elements of our room were a little 'tired' but we would certainly choose to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Top Spot”
Reviews.Author: Stuart R
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed 4 nights and as it was our first visit we thought it was very good hotel Professional staff, a large room and the food we had was of good quality. Very close to the tube and a bus stop out side. We can recommend this hotel as a great base to use to see London.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent choice of 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Juipi
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, you have bust stop and subway very close. You are also close of Nothinghill. Its a very nice hotel with great service and nice/clean rooms. Its a good option to enjoy London. Complementary coffee/tee. Regarding the price is a bit expensive but its a 4 star hotel and worth it. Wifi available in the lobby, but we had good signal from the 3rd floor. Iron available on the room.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room, good location”
Reviews.Author: analogue_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on a business trip. The room was huge, the bed was huge and very comfortable. The room and bathroom were clean with all the amenities you would expect. My room faced the main road overlooking Hyde park so there was a little noise but I slept well. The hotel is well located with the nearest tube station only a few minutes walk. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the heart of London”
Reviews.Author: DJA29
Reviews.Content: Great hotel situated right in theheart of hyde park. Really good rates, cheaper then nearby budget hotels, and nice food. Handy for underground. Only drawback was check out. Large coach parties checking out at same time nearly made me late for my meeting!

Reviews.Title: “Late booking”
Reviews.Author: donpotts
Reviews.Content: Booked this as a late deal after reading trip advisor . Room was fine , bed comfortable , tea , coffee and bottled water free. The room was clean as was the hotel . Breakfast was buffet style plenty of choice ( only complaint plastic scrambled egg!) proper coffee ( filter ).Good location opposite Hyde park - we walked across to get to National History museum etc. Tubes nearby, get off at Queensway . Plenty of restaurants nearby , Bella Italia , Starbucks etc , we ate at the hotel 1 night , food good. Wouldn't pay the asking price Â£ 265 per night - but was happy with hotel and our late deal!!

Reviews.Title: “Standard Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ian_ok
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights at the end of September, room and bathroom was OK size, lacked fridge and room safe. Internet was available for approx Â£15 per day, fortunately my room was located on 3rd floor and I was able to connect to the free wi-fi provided in the reception/bar area. Great location for heading into London, out to the big shopping centre

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but needs a re-fit”
Reviews.Author: Gegster
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night mid week. Room OK, breakfast OK - but nothing to write home about. Hardly any 3G connection in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good view”
Reviews.Author: ghoshsarkar
Reviews.Content: Good hotel with the best view of Hyde Park... The Big Bus stoppage was in front of the hotel gate which was an added advantage... loads of regular shops and restaurants were nearby... Oxford Street was closer by... No Wifi in the room... two computers were in the lobby... good & friendly staffs... Good breakfast served... rooms were small & toilet was smaller though.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay again or recommend...”
Reviews.Author: Jules9001
Reviews.Content: I stayed on Tuesday October 4th in a double room for single occupancy at the rate of Â£103. The displayed price in Reception was Â£250. It was very over-priced even for London. Overall the hotel is very worn and in need of a major refurbishment. My room on the 7th floor was particularly tatty and the decor was reminiscent of the 1970's in dark depressing brown that obviously was some years old. As is often the case, there was no socket by the bed which drives me insane. The bathroom was very poor and in need of a deep clean - the grout around the bath was horrible. I've added pictures that I hope show the chipped and tatty quality - the super secure door lock that looked like it had been subject frequently to a forced entry was particularly scary! A Travelodge or Holiday Inn Express is incredible value and quality in comparison to this hotel and I feel embarrassed that tourists might believe this represents an acceptable standard in the UK. The only highlight was a decent sized hairdryer but it was hanging on the wall as I'd visited a sports centre.

Reviews.Title: “VERY COMFORTABLE STAY”
Reviews.Author: SusanTear
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on the 4th October for 1 night. The room was spacious and quiet with a very large comfortable bed. The aircondition was very efficient and very welcoming on a warm day. The housekeeper came to check if we were happy with our room and did we require anything else. Reception check in was quick and easy with no waiting. The breakfast was delicious and there was plenty of choice both hot and cold. I would recommend this hotel for a very pleasent reasonable priced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: cjmunro
Reviews.Content: Near Queensway tube station, opposite Hyde Park and within walking distance of interesting parts of London (Notting Hill, Bayswater, Portobello Road) which means there are loads of bars restaurants nearby. Hotel itself has a nice outside area, its a bit small inside but acceptable!

Reviews.Title: “Good breakfast, clean”
Reviews.Author: Phantasialandfan
Reviews.Content: there is nothing particularly outstanding about this hotel unless you wish to be very close to Hyde Park. the nearest tube is Queensway and is therefore not that convenient for west end shows etc. the staff are very friendly and efficient. the rooms are clean and have all the essentials. the double glazing is not sufficient to block out traffic noise (we were on the side of the hotel). the breakfast is good. the beds are comfortable. the bathrooms are small. the water pressure is poor (we were on the 7th floor).

Reviews.Title: “Attended Wedding”
Reviews.Author: J C
Reviews.Content: We came to attend a wedding last weekend, I must admit the service we recieved was excellent and beyond expectation. The Asian Manager leading the service was very much helpful and accomodative. Having said i was not eating the starters because the choice given did not suite my palate. He staright away approached me and asked if i would like anything else and got me a nice and refreshing melon salad. For staff and service thumbs up to this hotel. Breakfast next morning was good but overcrowded, not the biggest restaurant for the size of the hotel. Staff were very efficient and helpful in breakfast. Reception staff were good while checking out. Now the average side guest room are not the best size for couples but were kept clean and tidy. I would definitely recomend this hotel to host events. Very good service thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, no complaints”
Reviews.Author: markmcloughlin
Reviews.Content: I had a very brief stay in the Ramada while on a business trip. The hotel is nicely located, near the tube. My single room was small, but perfectly fine and had a decent view. The bathroom was clean and there was no issues with any of the facilities. My room rate included breakfast and it was a decent breakfast, with a lot of choice. My colleague didn't have breakfast included and found it very expensive to pay for it separately. We had a drink in the bar, but there was no atmosphere. The staff were all pleasant and helpful. All, in all, an average hotel - nothing overly impressed, but there was no major issues to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “not great”
Reviews.Author: Moghm
Reviews.Content: very sub standard hotel. Ordered room service but couldnt take basic orders. Very noisy rooms with noise from within the hotel and from the road. Messed up my booking details. Below average hygiene. Difficult communication as staff were all foreign. Outdated 70's decor. Just would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “OK but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: MalcH
Reviews.Content: Very conscious that many reading this may be tourists/visitors looking for a place to stay in London so will try to give detail behind the title. Hotel itsef is in a good location, quite central, 5 mins walk from tube station, bus route outside, and Hyde Park literally across the road. Queensway is also a five minute walk and full of restaurants, couple of supermarkets, shops etc so in that respect a good area to stay. Its also just slightly set back so noise is not an issue. This time round my stay didnt start too well. I was given a double room and having unpacked decided to have a shower .... but it didnt work. had to call reception a couple of times before they came to sort, and agreed to move me to another room ... where the shower also didnt work. Again took more calls and about an hour later I got moved to a "Sky Suite" which book price shows at Â£350 a night !! To be fair to the hotel did resove, and did upgrade me but there seemed little urgency to resolve and I dd have to do all the chasing. Its also worth adding that the suite is actually no more than a standard double room in most hotels. The room itself was fine, comfy, good air con, nice bathroom etc so no complaints there. Having said that a couple of my colleagues were in single rooms on the mezzanine floor and these were tiny ... not much room at all. The bar/restaurant is ok, good service, and my colleagues who had dinner said the food was good. I only had breakfast which was normal mix of hot/cold buffet. Putting the shower problems to the side the hotel is OK. It is supposedly a 4 star but I would class more as 3 star. It is clean, the service is good, so in that respect I wouldnt want to put anyone off particularly if you have already booked. In terms of value for money I hope you all pay far less that the Â£250 - Â£350 per night they have as the book price as in my opinion its poor value for that price. If you pay half of that (which we did) then its an OK place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but below average accomodations”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel52885
Reviews.Content: The Ramada Hyde Park was a great location for a visit to London, England. It was right near Kensington Gardens, Kensington Palace and the underground (subway) and away from the congestion of London. A breakfast buffet was included with our plan but it was very bland and always the same. Some good restaurants nearby were Diana's Place (frequented by Princess Diana--pictures of her adorn the walls) and Champions (good pub for dinner). The room itself was very small, there was rust around the bathtub drain, the walls were paper thin (we could hear everything) and the hall and room carpet were stained. It really needed an upgrade!!

Reviews.Title: “On a cosmos tour”
Reviews.Author: hollyHuntingtown_MD
Reviews.Content: I was nervous about staying here after reading some of the reviews. However, the hotel was clean ( a little old). It is located in a good area with several tube stations nearby. The breakfast was good. It is not a luxury hotel, but i would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Basel
Reviews.Content: Great location, the room size was excellent comparing to other hotels in London, had a nice view for the Hyde Park. The staff were very friendly and the breakfast was great. However, when I checked in, they informed me that I have to pay for my breakfast although my reservation shows free full breakfast, when I informed this, they asked for proof, luckily I had my reservation printout with me, then they accepted to offer free breakfast. The rooms were clean but the towels were bit smelly. Overall, it was good and I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a facelift!”
Reviews.Author: mjrn875
Reviews.Content: My family & I stayed for 3 days and I was surprised at the poor quality of this hotel. The rooms are extremely small, air conditioning is inefficient, curtains and walls were dirty, and the bathroom ceiling had mold spots all over it. We consistently needed to ask for a second towel as my husband & I were given one towel for the two of us! I would not recommend this hotel unless it undergoes major renovations.

Reviews.Title: “Good things, and some not so good”
Reviews.Author: Overlaid
Reviews.Content: I was totally shocked on first arrival, to be given a room with a single bed. Although I do travel alone, this has never happened before or since. The A/C would not cool down the room, and I could not enter it during the day. These inconveniences were offset by the excellent breakfast, first rate service at the desk and the bar, and a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money”
Reviews.Author: Mvrck
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Ramada Hyde Park for an excellent early booking rate of Â£105 breakfast included. The room with a view to Kensington Gardens is worth a bonus. But I guess some of the guests don't even bother to cross the road and go there, as they only wait for the tour bus to stop at the hotel entrance. Which is pretty annoyng for them because it stops more than 10 meters away from the main entrance: the hotel should think about adjusting that. The room was quite hot and the metro even more, so some people better think of not going to London and use the metro. Nevertheless, I opened the window (for those who don't remember what it is, it's that glass sliding thing on the wall) and appreciated the city roar for sometime, reading a good book and stretching after a wonderful day in London (I guess that's why I could sleep, in the second floor, even if there's traffic in the street just below). The breakfast was excellent and attention kind and permanent. They should have some more tables though, as some guests think staying in London is spending their time watching the traffic go by in the dining room. By the way, there is a tremendous traffic in London and an incredible number of tourists - or wouldn't it be the most visited city in the world. I took the time to express my suggestions to the hotel but also told them they're going to be my choice again if they keep doing the same. I am surprised how much people is there in the world thinking they worth something just because they have the possibility to drop some lines here. For them, one suggestion: have a life.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: barilyn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights and found the hotel to be very good and the staff were very helpful in all matters. The breakfast was good and plentiful. The bed were comfortable and clean. We would recommend this hotel to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “We were disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Alla B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights as part of a group tour. We've specially chosen "four star" in London and were disappointed because some rooms do not correspond to the "star": old furniture, dilapidated walls, terrible view out the window. Bed linen was dirty and we had big problems with its replacement. In other words the hotel needs Improvement. The positive side of this hotel is excelent food and location (very close to the center, Hyde Park and Queensway station).

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Bristolmember
Reviews.Content: We stated at this hotel in May 2011 for weekend break over the bank holiday period. We had a two night deal for Â£199 and paid an extra Â£30.00 for champagne,chocolates and fruit. When we intially arrived we were allocated a big room in a quiet part of the hotel. Unfortunatley the air condition was not working and could not be fixed so we were transferred to another room. This room was smaller and was facing the hyde park road and was fairly noisey. The bathroom was on the the small side and had a old shower curtain which was stained..not very hygienic. The walls in the room were paper thin and we were kept up most of the night by a snoring man in the room next door and the very soft beds. The mattresses need to be changed as they are so worn. The room itself was decorated well and had plenty of mirrors which is useful. There was tea / coffee making facilities and complimentry water which was anice touch. We ate in the hotel's restraurant and had two fanastic tasty curries- would recommend trying them. The drinks were also reasonably priced and the staff who worked therer were all very friendly and efficient. The hotel is in a great position for exploring London a couple of minutes walk from Queensway tube station and a bus stop is right opposite. It is also very close to Paddington train station. All in all it is a good hotel in a great location with helpful staff. The rooms need updating though!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but a very average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MattausMuller
Reviews.Content: My room in the hotel was too hot during the day, even though the air con was on all day at full blast. The air con was also quite loud, but it had to be left on all night to keep the room cooler. Also, you could hear the traffic outside, so I definitely wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone who is a light sleeper. No free wi-fi in the room, but they gave me a password and I could use the wi-fi in the ground floor lounge there for free. For some reason, the ironing board was half the length of a normal ironing board, which made it really hard to iron my shirts properly. I can't see the point of this at all and I found it really annoying. The plus point of this hotel is the location though, within 3 minutes of leaving the hotel, you can be in Kensington Gardens or in Queensway Tube Station on the Central Line. I managed to book this hotel at half price, so it was bearable, but I wouldn't recommend it, even at that price.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Improvement”
Reviews.Author: DKHNL
Reviews.Content: While not the worst hotel I've been too, I would not choose to stay here again. I reserved my room through Ramada.com. I normally don't like Ramada's in the US, but have found their properties abroad better. My rate included breakfast, but when I checked in I was told that it didn't. The front desk agent wanted proof and needed a printed confirmation. With nowhere to print, I was asked to email the reception my confirmation showing them that my rate included breakfast. I was immediately put off with her attitude. The hallways have no ventilation and London was experiencing rather hot weather. When I got to my room, it was stifling. In order to operate the power in the room, you need to insert your room key in an outlet to operate the lights. ac, etc. I immediately did so hoping the room would cool off. Sadly, it never did. The room itself was larger than I anticipated. It appeared to have been renovated in the last few years, but the renovations were not done well. The carpeting looked new and room was relatively nice looking at first glance. BUT after closer inspection I found many things wrong. The desktop was chipped in places and peeling off, the tile in the entry way and bathroom stained, the door frame was chipped and tattered and my door wouldn't shut unless pulled shut. The bath tub was chipped and water was leaking from an upper drain. The air conditioning unit really didn't work. The room never really cooled off and in the evening, it was nicer to be outside than in the room. Due to safety concerns, you couldn't open the window more than a few inches. It remained uncomfortable. The next morning before I left the hotel, I had asked for the a/c unit to be checked out and the leaking water to be repaired. The a/c was never fixed. When I returned to the hotel at 5:00, my room had still not been serviced. I called and then left for a couple of hours. At 8:00, my room still had not been serviced. I was not pleased. The hotel is used by lot's of tour groups. Throughout the night and in the morning, you could hear doors slamming shut. If you're a light sleeper, this could be a problem. Breakfast wasn't anything special, but I found the staff in the restaurant to be friendly, courteous, and professional. The concierge was also helpful. While not super friendly at first, he helped me arrange for transport to Heathrow. When they did not show up at the arranged time, he immediately called without my asking. He came out to tell me that he had called and that a car would be here within 15 minutes. The hotel is in a nice location. It's across the street from Hyde Park and close to Queensway where there are a ton of restaurants and tube stops.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: joylin
Reviews.Content: I had a good deal with this hotel through Last Minute.com. As I have stayed here before I know some of the room can be rather tired looking. I put in a request for a room on the higher floors overlooking the park which I got. The room was 501. It was clean with tea making facilities, bath with a shower. The only thing was that it was very warm and had no AC. The staff were friendly and we would stay again but not if we had to pay full price.

Reviews.Title: “Not a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: green_eyes4224
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel as part of a group tour. Our rooms were in the Mezzinine area which in essence was the basement! Go up one floor, then through double doors, down stairs to a dark, dingy hallway with rooms. The double doors slammed every time you went through. The rooms we were given overlooked the garbage area...nice!!! I'm angry that this hotel passed this kind of room off as a quality room for travellers. This was a disappointing hotel and we would not suggest it to any of our friends. It was a poor start to our tour.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: TheCarvers
Reviews.Content: Stay here regularly on business - one of the more reasonably priced London hotels for what you get. Rooms are OK, last time I stayed in a "suite" - but no it was just a refurbished bedroom (is there a legal definition of a suite as this is the second time this has happened to me in different hotel chains). Breakfast is perfectly alright and waiting on staff are helpful/cheery (just get there early to beat the tourists - do they ever sleep). Easy walking distance of three tubes serviced by different lines and loads of restaurants in Queensway.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and very pleasant location”
Reviews.Author: JOTTexas
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights and found this convenient, fairly inexpensive and within walking distance of the tube station and plenty of great restaurants. The staff was very helpful and the rooms were clean confortable. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Baware of power outlets in room”
Reviews.Author: Dina1224
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location within walking distance of Hyde Park and Notting Hill. Beware of the power outlets!! I used my hair straightening iron with the proper electricity converter in Paris and Greece in the past, and had no issues at all. I plugged it in correctly at this hotel and it fried my hair straightener. Upon complaining to the hotel they did not take responsibly for the faulty outlets!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Victoria22
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights end of June with parents who were attending a Royal Garden Party. Got a good deal with Expedia. Had 2 rooms on top floor. A short walk from Queensway tube station (less than 5 mins). Quick check-in. Lift up to top floor. Only 1 lift was working for the 4 days that we were there but it didn't matter too much. Rooms a good size with good size bathroom. Comfy beds, large TV, large windows with a view over rooftops at back of hotel, good dark curtains, tea and coffee making facilities etc. The shower didn't have a lot of pressure but was adequate. Parents window wouldn't open when we got there so the room was hot and stuffy but a quick call to reception and they sorted it. Didn't have a breakfast (Â£15) as there were plenty of local cafe's serving breakfast. One right next to the tube station was a third of teh price and very good. Ate in local pubs and good Italian restaurants in the evenings. Across the road is beautiful Hyde Park and Kensington Gardens. Had breakfast there in the Orangery one morning. I would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Papoofnik
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and room modern and functional, although a bit small, but typical for London. I was only there for 1 night so did not use other hotel features. I was not unhappy with the room rate given the time of year, and it is London. I chose the hotel for brand name and location (for ease of access to venues and city, and safety), and price. It provided all 3 quite well and I was not disappointed. Location is very good, both for walking and tube, and easy to get taxis, all features I like in a London hotel to give flexibility. I would have no reservations about staying here again and would give this hotel the opportunity to bid for my custom.

Reviews.Title: “Completely rubbish.”
Reviews.Author: CheltenhamCheltenham
Reviews.Content: Stayed last night Monday 11th July Where do I start! Booked a double room through Laterooms.com which they charged us Â£180 for a one night stay. With the location of this hotel, we thought we had a really good deal...... on arrival, they told us we had a twin, upon showing them our booking confirmation they told us they were fully booked and had no doubles available, so we asked for a small discount on our bill to make up for their mistake. Amazingly a double room suddenly became "available" and we were given an upgrade..... Room 750 "Executive Double". What a complete joke. Tiny room, No mini bar, window unopenable, noisiest air conditioning unit I have ever heard in a hotel room, the bare basics of 1 shampoo, 1 shower gel, soap and 1 bath towel for 2 people!! As we got back from meeting friends so late, we decided to stick it out for the night. The room was like a sauna, so the inneficial air conditioning was vital sadly as at 3am it sounded like a plane taking off. At around 1am we ordered room service, and the most bizarre thing happened. When it arrived, i tried to explain to the deliverer that sadly I didn't have a penny of cash to tip him. He then told me the room service came to 40 pounds and that I should go to reception and pay by card!!!!!!!!!!!!! In my pyjamas and bare feet!!!!!!!! Was he that desperate for me to include a tip!!?? Confused and befudled I simply shut the door on him. I don't know if this was a joke or if he was as grumpy and odd as he appeared to be, but either way I didn't appreciate it. I don't go anywhere in my pyjamas with large men in the early hours of the morning even if they do think they are entitled to a tip for doing there job. The room had so many defects it's pointless to list them all, but believe me, everything from a sink plug that didn't open properly to dusty carpets it was a shambles. If we had paid full price for this farce it would have been a staggering Â£380. As it was paying Â£180 for it felt like a rip off. Plus Â£25 carparking fees it felt like a scam. If it wasn't for the fab location I would have given this hotel just 1 star. I've read the feedback from the manager regarding refurbs, maybe room 750 was given to us simply as they had cocked our booking up and they don't usually use this room?? I desperately hope that this is the case and they don't actually charge anybody Â£380 for this "executive" room and that it is waiting to be refurbed. We didn't complain on the day as in the morning we had a mad rush to appointments, I have mobile video footage of the room, and when I eventually work out how to upload it onto my computer I'll happily send it to Ramada. Sadly I feel Ramada have tourists and business customers over a barrel here. The location is great and rooms around this area are not easy to get at short notice. Walking out without staying would not be an option for most people. I won't be giving any Ramada hotel my money ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Hotel Needs Renovating”
Reviews.Author: adamsaintlouis
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is really good. Right next to a Tube stop, and across the street from wonderful Hyde Park. If you want the hop-on hop-off busses there is a stop right out front. The breakfast was also very good and included in our rate. There was a computer with free internet in the lobby. The rooms are very dated, dirty, and not up to standard. I saw two mouse traps under out air conditioning unit - actually our son found them :( The bathrooms were also dated and in need of repair. Overall, great location, but the hotel needs to be renovated! Not sure there normal prices, but during the UEFA Championship weekend rates were really high, so for the money I do not think this is a good deal overall.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable bed, good location, nice view”
Reviews.Author: 186334Louise
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights whilst celebrating my husband's 50th birthday. Our room was comfortable and clean, with a lovely view over the grounds at the back of Kensington Palace ( we were on the 7th floor). Experienced some traffic noise but not enough to disturb our sleep; the bed was very comfortable. Dont know if all rooms have views over the Parks, so may be best to ask when you book if that's what you want. Location is good - just a short tube ride away from most of London's main sites, and close to 2 tube stations (Queensway and Bayswater). Also plenty of local shops and restaurants within a short walking distance. Service at reception was polite and efficient. Buffet breakfast was on a par with other similar hotels we've stayed at. Just a few little things that we thought could be improved on. For a 4 star hotel the toiletries provided in the room could have been better, eg. there was no shower gel or body lotions, only small bars of soap and small bottles of shampoo. The shower itself was not very powerful. Also, only one pack of two biscuits to go with the tea and coffee - one biscuit each which seems a bit mean! Overall though, an enjoyable stay, and we would use the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: bluebluebells
Reviews.Content: Great location. Lovely breakfast... Reception staff friendly.... That's the positives Hotel run down. Chips in the bathroom tiles. Rooms cleaned to a very poor standard. We could see the dust on the bedside cabinets and behind the lights. The radiator/ aircon grills were full of fluff. On opening the draw there was even a dirty hairbrush left there by a previous guest. Beds very soft, bottom sheet didn't quite cover mattress protector. We had booked to see a show, so dumped bags and went out. It was late when we got back to our room so didnt mention all this to reception until the morning. They were apologetic, knocked Â£15 off the parking bill. They did say they were getting quotes to have the fluff and muck taken out the radiators. Sorry Ramada, after staying in many hotels in London I was expecting better.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok!”
Reviews.Author: orlandouk
