Reviews.Content: We visited this Hotel in May 2011 thanks to Tesco Vouchers! We checked in around 230pm with around 5 couples waiting to be checked in before us and it took around 20 minutes or so to be checked in with only 2 clerks checking people in which wasnt a good start. We requested for a room overlooking Hyde Park a few weeks before our visit which we got but the room was very old looking and was in need of desperate repair and needed upgrading though the bed was comftable though the room could do with a bit of TLC The breakfast room was nice and there was loads to choose from including a Hot buffet type breakfast and alot of continental breakfast to choose from, The breakfast room was quite modern looking The Hotel also has a restaurant at night which we didnt use but we did use the bar at night and sat outside where you can watch people going by and it is heated sometimes heated. The Hotel is quite close to the Underground station and there is a London bus stop right outside and there is a London bus tour company bus stop right outside where you can buy tickets from and get on the bus for a tour of London where you can hop on and off all day

Reviews.Title: “Decent London hotel”
Reviews.Author: Coddfish
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for one night mid week, following a concert in Hyde Park. The hotel appeared busy, with many North American guests staying as part of a tour party. We were offered a room at the side on the 7th floor, which was described as the 'Executive Floor'. Upon exiting the lift, there was a small flight of steps down to the floor, and we saw that a lady in a wheelchair was having to be helped to exit from her room - one wonders what would happen if there was a fire? The room was small but had everything we needed. Usual arrangement of a shower over a bath in a small bathroom, with small thin towels. The room was rather difficult to cool, with its aircon unit floor mounted under the window, so the cold air blew straight up behind the curtains. We arrived back from our concert after 11pm and, as we had not eaten, went to see if we could get anything in the bar. The barman sent for the night porter, who had a couple of toasted sandwiches made up for us, just what we needed. We also had breakfast the following day, where you could get eggs freshly cooked as well as the various buffet options. We had a slight problem at check-out, when they tried to charge the 'morning' rate for the breakfast we had pre-booked at checkin, but that was quickly resolved.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: jeannumber1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, booked a week-end break at the hotel to have a break and take in a show. From the moment we entered the hotel we felt so comfortable. The lady on reception was polite and helpful, even joked with us being smokers!!! Our room was clean, in full working order and had a decent view over Kensington Park. Breakfast was perfect with curtious staff on hand. Great location to explore from and handy for everything. Conceige very helpful. Overall an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: grj11188
Reviews.Content: The Ramada Hyde Park overlooks Kensington Gardens and Hyde Park. The rooms are elegant & modern. Paddington Station is nearby which allows for easy access to Heathrow. The fashionable shopping areas of Oxford Street and the West End theatres are nearby. The breakfast was wholesome and watching the sunset at the Arts Bar was just magical

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, basic, but still not too bad”
Reviews.Author: dodds77
Reviews.Content: The room was roasting, so stuck the AC on and left it all day, came back to my room and it was just fine except for a little smell from the AC unit. Very noisy though as a whole, the walls are thin so you can hear anything really. Basic room, nothing startling, typical London hotel with regards to space, you get all the amenities you need. Decent location although its a fair walk into Oxford Street, but as you'd guess from the name, Hyde Park is on its doorstep. Breakfast was a no-go as I had to leave before 7.

Reviews.Title: “Best for the price”
Reviews.Author: scotsman111
Reviews.Content: this was our second stay here and as far as london hotels go this is the best value hotel we have found the rooms are a decent size the service is first class its close to everything bus at the door tube around the corner will be back for sure

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but thin walls means it can be noisy on occasion”
Reviews.Author: princess2611
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights, for our honeymoon. We have previously stayed in the Ealing hotel in the Ramada chain, and liked it so we thought this one would be as good. On the whole, we enjoyed our stay, the room seemed to be slightly larger and a bit more luxurious than the rooms in the Ealing hotel, but we did have a few problems with noise. - It's a minor thing, but the tea/coffee tray was excellent! We was impressed with that ;) We stayed on the fourth floor, in a room overlooking the main road and Hyde Park. Traffic noise was instantly noticeable when we arrived in the room, yet surprisingly was not an issue for us, as we didn't notice it really when we went to bed. The thing that did cause us problems however, was noisy neighbours! We had a door in our room which adjoined us to the next room along (a feature I think present in most rooms on this floor, if not the whole hotel) - the door was locked obviously (but someone did try the handle one night when they arrived- somewhat off-putting whilst trying to go to sleep!) but did mean we could hear next door rather clearly. It was unfortunate that the first morning we were there next door were packing up very loudly early in the morning and had an alarm that kept going off. Another night we was kept awake by the next room along having a noisy gathering! However, I appreciate this is no fault of the hotel, it is just people being selfish. If you are a really light sleeper, I would probably say this hotel isn't for you, due to thin walls and traffic noise, but I would still recommend it. The reception staff were friendly and tried to help wherever they could. One issue we did have was the concierge on duty the morning we were leaving was very bad-tempered, and he didn't listen when we had said that one of our items to be put in luggage storage was fragile (a canvas), and he was very abrupt and heavy-handed with our luggage which did stress me out somewhat as I was anxious to keep the canvas in one piece! He seemed very rude and did not give a good impression of the hotel. The other members of the concierge team we spoke to (namely the young man with glasses and the other concierge on duty that afternoon we were leaving) were very helpful and friendly. We chose not to include breakfast in our package, so we can't comment on that. The bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was clean and nice enough. The only thing I would say about the bathroom is the shower head is rather low, I am only 5 ft 7 and I had to stoop a little bit to get under the shower! My husband at 6 ft obviously had more trouble than me. Again, not such an issue as we still had a nice stay. The hotel is I would say middle budget level for London, and we were happy enough with it. The location was brilliant, it was about 5 min walk to Queensway tube station, which is on the Central line and can take you directly into the centre of town in about 10 mins. We also walked through Hyde Park one morning all the way into the centre (Oxford Circus, Regent Street) and although it was quite a long walk, it was a lovely way to start the day :) There is a spar right near the tube station, and there are coffee shops and restaurants nearby so easy enough to find what you need. Overall we enjoyed our stay, we had a good honeymoon, but there are definite issues with noise - due to the adjoining room layout. We would probably stay here again if we go to London again, as it is a pleasant hotel despite the noise, and in a great location - not very far (10 min walk I think) from Paddington Station.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alex044
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the weekend of June 5-6. Location is great single rooms are 11x11sqft incl bathroom! staff is friendly and helpful. I had cobwebs on the windows and only the 3rd room that I was shown was clean. I guess its ok for the price $200 and good location. Just opposite Kensington Gardens and only few minutes taxi from Paddingtion ($10) As mentioned by other reviewers the property is old and run down some of the rooms look upgraded. Overall its a good location and safe are but thats it.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the location.”
Reviews.Author: theyallexist
Reviews.Content: During April and May we stayed at Ramada Hyde Park on two occassions for a total of five nights. - our first room was on the first floor right on the internal walkway, the room was clean, and the noise wasn't too much of an issue. - our second room was on the top floor with stunning views of Hyde Park. The breakfast service really lets this place down, the service is sloppy and slow, if it isn't already included in your price don't option it on, you will find better value on your walk into the city. The free wifi in the common room on the ground floor was excellent, and something all hotels need to offer. The location is what really sells this place. We would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “City Break”
Reviews.Author: SpeedyTravellers
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located for Hyde Park and Kensington Gardens and a short walk from both Queensway and Notting Hill Gate underground stations on the Central Line. We had dinner on one night which was good. The breakfast was plentiful but there were issues on the speed of refreshing food on the buffet. Also the staff were extremely slow at clearing the tables. The room was clean and comfortable and surprisingly quiet considering the hotel's location on Baywater Road.

Reviews.Title: “Run down hotel and charged way too much.”
Reviews.Author: philips-2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and had seen the pictures on the internet beforehand which did look nice. However, when we got into the room, it was so small and was very out-dated and really needs to be refurbished. I feel that i got conned as we paid Â£330 altogether for both nights. The carpet had stains on, the chairs looked as if they had come out of a grubby pub. The bathroom was also very old, the sink had a crack in whihch had turned yellow, the bottom of the bath was brown/black and the toilet seat was broken which kept on moving when you sat on it. The mirror frames are that old the paint is actually chipping of them too. After the forst day, we went out and when we came back we thought great our room had got cleaned, however, the maid didnt even do this. They just made the made and didnt bother to take the dirty cups and glasses from our room. They didnt even fill the tea and milk up. This is really not a 4 star hotel. On top of all of this, when we left the member of staff tried to charge us for movies, but i had to tell her that we had already paid for this has it is already included in the double deluxe room that we have already paid for. On their website, it also states that your view is the kensington gardens, but the actual view is the coach car-park in the park and thats all you can see with the path way of the actuaul park. The hotel is based on a main road, whiich is ok if you dont mind to hear lots of noise especially throughout the night. The breakfast was not very good too, it tasted very old as if it had been warmed up from many days ago. I would never stay here and would not reccomend it as it is really out dated.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mahesh B
Reviews.Content: The service was great and friendly staff. Because of earlier experiences elsewhere, we insisted on viewing the allotted rooms before occupation. They were not-so-great rooms, side street views, and lower floor, with additional steps from the lift to the corridor. We insisted on a change and better rooms were allotted on a higher floor â€“ one room with great view of Hyde Park and another with a side view. Rooms were comfortable, with ironing boards, air conditioning was OK. Great location opposite Hyde Park, and close to tube Notting hill gate tube station (green yellow red lines) and 3 bus stops away from Marble Arch and the shopping areas on Oxford Street The restaurant was lovely in spite of same breakfast served daily.

Reviews.Title: “Standard and functional commercial hotel”
Reviews.Author: BigChas
Reviews.Content: Well-appointed room. Friendly staff. I had a late supper, which was okay, but fairly standard. Puzzling fixed service charge of Â£3 added to the food bill. The hotel is business-oriented, so the breakfast is self-service and unmemorable. Nearest undergrounds are Queensway and Bayswater. Hilarious room service guide featuring 11 gallons of lager (cut and pasted from their wholesaler's list?). Many restaurants nearby in Bayswater.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with a friendly staff and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: janet1101
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a short break in Ramada London Hyde Park and I liked it a lot. The location is perfect, few steps from Kensington Gardens and Hyde Park and 40min nice walk through Oxford and Regent Street full of shops to Picadilly Circus. Staff is always friendly, helpfull, polite and professional. Rooms are spacious enough and always spotlessly clean. Breakfast and room servis choice more than adequate. If I happen to go back to London will definitely stay in Ramada Hyde Park again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms good value for money, pleasant a few hic ups”
Reviews.Author: Fizzogg
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 2 nights using my clubcard vouchers for January this year. We had 2 rooms one family and one double and I had requested them close togethier which they were. Checkin was good and speedy and I loved our room. The bed was bigger than usual and there was a sofa bed for our daughter. I was pleasantly surprised. The room was clean and albeit a bit on te small side when the sofa bed was pulled out but manageable. Unfortunatley during our stay on the first night there was a private function and the noise was loud. Having been allocated rooms above the function room also meant that we did not get any peace until 1 am when it stopped despite complaining and also having a child with us meant she got very tired too. Breakfast was a bit of a nightmare the following morning with the hotel not replenishing food as it was getting towards the end of service. Bearing in mind we were late to bed because of hotel noise we were late to breakfast too! Our second night and second experience of breakfast was very different in a positive way. We had complained adn really complained! We couldn't get any refund as I had paid with vouchers but what the hotel did do was offer us a complimentary night stay within 6 months. We will be returning to the hotel for this stay on April 16 and I am looking forward to going back despite our initial problems. We have been offered "quiet" rooms and I don't think the hotel will dissapoint. Despite the problems we had on our first visit I did like this hotel as I think it does offer value for money compared to other hotels in London and the location is good. I have stayed in many places from travelodge to the Savoy and it gets a good from me.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alison92-95
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed her for 5 nights and found this to be a lovely hotel. After reading some reviews I was a bit unsure about the visit, however, this really is a clean hotel. The colour of the carpets were a bit drab in the corridors but is that really something to complain about! I had booked on the internet and got a very good deal for a standard room. I requested a high floor, quiet room. On check in we were advised that only executive rooms were on the top floor and so they had upgraded us at no extra cost (very impressed). The room was really nice, comfortable and quiet. Breakfast was a dream, good selection, no queuing and very relaxing. The drinks in the hotel were expensive but that was to be expected. However, we bought our own wine to take to the room and asked for an ice bucket at the bar, which they were very happy to provide us with. Good location with Queensway tube station five minutes away. Overall this was a great week and the hotel definately made all the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and friendly staff, nothing else good”
Reviews.Author: SorinMihaescu
Reviews.Content: Well, letâ€™s start with the good points: great locations just few tube stations for main touristic interest points, I do mean just a few (3-5). Staff was friendly also and helpful, even give back very quickly my Credit Card which I forgot at Checking In. Room was also very warm (more than I like but good for my wife and small baby) as they had a heater inside. Internet was also for free in my room, also a good thing. Now letâ€™s move to the not so good things which are more than the good things if you ask me: - Rooms were either not so clean or more probably very, very old and looked rather not clean. Actually we cancelled the plans to give our baby a bath in their bathtub. - No fridge in the room just the window inside (as there were double windows with 10cm between them) could slide just a little so you could put few things there and with the cold weather food did not spoil. This sliding window was also a issue as I could feel the draft from there close to the window or at floor level. - Breakfast was hardly decent and as when I travel tends to be most important meal this was a drawback and also there was no porridge (really, in UK???) which my baby just started to eat at Sheraton Skyline previous days. Not to mention the glasses at the breakfast were not clean as was also the baby chair (which I think was only one for all restaurant, luckily there were no other small children when we had breakfast) - Noisy, considering previous 3 nights we stayed at a hotel near airport there was no problem, here in the middle of the city there was a lot of noise from the street, mostly the cars as the windows did not provide any protection.

Reviews.Title: “Very Helpful staff but hotel accommodation is not 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: B1ggl3s
Reviews.Content: We arrived expecting a comfortable and freindly hotel that warranted the amount that we had paid for the rooms per night. Despite the inflated prices that London demands, the room was not particularly clean and the furnishings cramped and crowded. The rather tired decorations of the corridors and their austerity, faded carpets and dark walls with no pictures added to the sense that we were about to begin a sentence rather than a holiday. However the staff and care can be commended for their efforts as the reception was efficient and helpful and the dining room staff kept a busy room moving and the fairly standard breakfast fare stocked and abundant. However it is unlikely that with careful research a better value stay cannot be found.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: TopCat50
Reviews.Content: Good points: 1) Location. 2) Check in. Bad points: 1) Noisy (no double or secondary glazing). 2) Definitely not of 4 star quality. Needs refurbishment as very dated. Breakfast adequate. If you require a 4 star would recommend Hilton or Radisson Edwardian.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: howdentravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a two night break and found it very clean and the staff helpful. The location is very good only a short walk to either the Queensway tube station or Notting Hill tube, and directly opposite Kensington Gardens and a lovely walk across to Kensingston High street, the Albert Hall and the museums. A short walk from the hotel brought you to a good pub The room we had was a good size and being at the front of the hotel was reasonably noisey, exactly what you'd expect in the centre of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, good location and food ok”
Reviews.Author: grumpygrandadSwansea
Reviews.Content: Good location, within zone 1 underground, across road from Hyde park, less than mile from paddington and walking distance to Notting Hill. Room small but comfortable. Reception staff very helpful but dining room staff poor. A good base for a visit to london.

Reviews.Title: “not bad but not great either”
Reviews.Author: icepackbv
Reviews.Content: For a 4-star hotel I had expected a bit more. I'd like to stress it wasn't all that bad but just small things. I feel the hotel needs a makeover. It's seen better days! Our room was small, no cupboard/storage just a shelf and coatrack with hangers. Bathroom small, our bath needed some TLC and vigorous cleaning around the taps. No safe either although there is a safet-depositbox at reception. Walls are thin....you can enjoy your neighbours conversations, tv selection et al. Great beds though, housecleaning up and at it quite early. Staff very helpful. Roomservice prompt, quite tasty and reasonably priced. Free WiFi in the lounge. Location is great obviously 2 tubes (1 at 250m and 1 at 750), 2 stops from Westfield shopping mall, great Italian Zizzi at 500m. As I stated at the start, this hotel has a lot going for it but I just missed some dotted i's and crossed t's. We also forgot something when we checked out and only discovered this back home. Just wondering if they'll let us know something was found. IU would not recpmmend this hotel to my friends as I know my friends but if you're after a no-frill stop-over in london it will suffice although there are better out there.

Reviews.Title: “Warning!! Do not go to this hotel especially during winter”
Reviews.Author: billieli
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel we have ever been. No air condition in the winter. Only a small heater in our room, which makes us frozen. After staying in this hotel for one night. We both get sick, which ruined our whole trip. The most stupid thing is they refuse to do refund or anything when we wanna change to another hotel. Finally, we went to another hotel for the rest of our vacation but paying both hotel. And due to the illness getting from ramada hotel we didn't go to any place in london. For anyone who go on tripadvisor, don't ever try this hotel. This hotel is really a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Location and Superb staff”
Reviews.Author: DevonLad
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 2 nights at the Ramada Hyde Park. This is a very good hotel, great value for money and is in a very good location.Booked weekend break through Omega Holidays highly recommended. I would like to thank Max the manager and his excellent team for looking after us, the concieage desk staff were very helpful at all times. The breakfast was excellent a good start to the day, the serivce very good, coffee/tea served as soon as we sat down and as much as you wanted, just ask. Our room was at the front of the hotel as requested with a view over Kensington Gardens, thanks for sorting that out Max and for the bottle of wine for my wifes birthday, nice touch.The room was spacious a little noisey with the traffic at night, but it is London and not a problem. The hotel is only about 250m from Queensway Tube Station and there are bus stops within 50m, we were very impressed with the London Transport system and found it easy to get around. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel for a break in London. Merry Christmas and a Happy New Year to all the staff. Peter and Sonia PS This is nothing to do with the hotel, Curry House in Queensway, awful food stay away worst curry we have ever had, I could cook an Indian better than them without trying.

Reviews.Title: “One Bed rooms bad value business rooms good value”
Reviews.Author: TamTarifa
Reviews.Content: I was excited staying in the Ramada London Hyde Park as I had had good experience in the past with the Ramade chain of hotel. But I felt it important to let other travelers know that the one bedroom rooms in the Ramada are absolutly tiny I felt positively claustrophobic and at a cost of 175 GBP (which is what we paid) really very steep for what was on offer. I did complain and to the hotels credit they accomodated me in a bigger room by upgrading me this was very nice and it was not something the Hotel had to do so I appreciated the gesture. The other room was very nice and cleaniliness room amenities etc were very good. The hotel restuarant had very nice choice and the staff were very friendly. So I would stay here again but I would not book the single rooms only the bigger rooms and pay the extra.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Queenslander65
Reviews.Content: We had 5 very pleasant nights at this hotel in early October 2010 to begin our European holiday. It was perfectly adequate for our needs, with ample space in a standard double. We arrived after a 22 hour long haul from Sydney early on a rainy London morning. Our room wasn't ready (although other guests who arrived on the same airport transfer were given immediate access to a room). There was no where in the lobby where we could have a little privacy to organise ourselves to go out (reorganise our luggage for jackets etc) while we waited for the room to be made up. We were not offered any staff assistance in this regard. Not compulsory I suppose but would have made a hugh impression of superior service if the staff had been a bit more sensitive to our needs in this regard. We returned to the hotel at 2pm and checked in to Rm 466. It was perfectly adequate. Comfortable, clean, nicely furnished, good air conditioning and bathroom (small but all the plumbing worked). There was ample room to unpack and place bags away, good desk space and chairs to sit in as well as a comfortable and clean king size bed. Room cleaning was always good. Breakfast was included in our package. That was very good although it helped to get to breakfast before the rush. Real good cup of tea served and good variety of hot food. But the real benefit of this hotel is the location. Right on the Bayswater road oposite the Park and Kensington Gardens), close to the tube, and excellent facilities and restaurants around Queensway and Notting Hill (both walkable). With an Travelcard/Oyster card in tow, London is yours. We loved it. (Noticed that the rack rate for this hotel is 260 pounds per double).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location, friendly staff, awesome breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: vancouba
Reviews.Content: Just loved this hotel, very good location, across from Hyde Park. 5 minute taxi ride to oxford street. Friendly and helpful staff. Excellent breakfast, and lunch and dinner menu is so good. I highly recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable with a prime location”
Reviews.Author: ziptang
Reviews.Content: We had a limited budget, and we all know hotel rooms in London are small to begin with. I couldnt complain about anything. The room was clean, the bed was beyond comfortable and the bathroom was spotless. On check in, we were asked if we'd like a room with a view of the park. It was cute, but got a little loud as traffic picked up. This shouldn't bother you unless your a light sleeper. If your traveling with a partner, ask for extra towels on check in, as its something I've noticed is typical of UK hotels. The stay was great and both my partner and myself agreed we'd come back as soon as we could. The location was great for us as it was very close to a tube stop, and many resturants with in Bayswater and Notting Hill. The staff was professional and friendly. The hotel has a resturant/bar that is excellent as well.

Reviews.Title: “Real Air Conditioning! Great hotel for the value.”
Reviews.Author: AGarrote
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here at the beginning of August. We had a tastefully decorated and relatively spacious room with a single queen-sized bed. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was small but adequate, it had great water pressure and temperature. The air conditioning unit in the room was awesome. London is warm in August, and even though our room faced St Petersburgh Place (the side street), it was a bit noisy with the window open. The staff were very helpful and courteous. The breakfast was excellent. Location was convenient to two Tube stations, and an ecclectic mix of shops and restaurants. A few blocks in one direction and you get the Middle Eastern, Indian, and Russian restaurants of Queensway. A few blocks in the opposite direction brings you to the trendier Notting Hill district. Only two slight negatives about the room. The air conditioner would drip condensation if left too cold for too long, but keeping it at 72 F worked fine. Also, the curtain track was falling down on one side, but it still worked ok.

Reviews.Title: “I'd never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: dafbaker
Reviews.Content: Mould in bathroom. Room run down. Couldn't close window. Meal to room was awful and no salt and pepper. Room not clean. Hassle checking in. Restaurant for breakfast in absolute chaos. Aircon didn't work. Took 3 goes to get a receipt. I could go on... Not the standard I expect for Â£176.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient (slightly noisy) location and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: grumpygordon2
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as a base for visiting the theatre and sightseeing. It is just a few hundred yards from Queensway Central line tube station, opposite a coach and car park and has a bus stop immediately outside from which open top bus tours depart at regular intervals. The reception, bar and restaurant staff were all efficient, helpful and polite, and the food was excellent, particularly the buffet breakfast with a wide choice ranging from cerials and fresh fruit to full English. Our double room on the 3rd floor at the front of the hotel was comfortable and spacious although noise from the road and restaurant airconditioning was still noticeable despite the double glazed windows. After a busy day out the background hum did not stop us falling asleep but would request a quiter room at the back if available next time. On Sunday mornings artists display their paintings for sale on the railings of Kensington Gardens/Hyde Park along the Bayswater Road and a walk from the hotel to Lancaster Gate tube station at the start of our return journey admiring artwork on route capped off a great weekend break. - Recommended and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice room & great views from room!”
Reviews.Author: HilsAlive
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend. Check-in was easy and very surprised to receive upgrade to a suite on the top floor. Had views over Kensington Gardens in one direction and across to the London skyline in another direction. (Special occasion - think husband asked for a 'nice room' - well we certainly got that!) Flowers, champagne, fruit, and chocolates were in the suite on arrival, as ordered (again, by husband!). All were very nice quality. Used frequent bus service just outside hotel to travel into London - about 10 minutes on bus to Marble Arch/Oxford Street. Tube stop nor far away too, but didn't use. Breakfast was great and was served 'til noon on Sunday - fab after a late Saturday night out. Only 'complaint' would be that our newspapers weren't brought to the room on Sunday morning as requested. Oh, and our bar bill for 2 drinks (doubles) was Â£22 - a bit steep, but then again, it's a London hotel. NB: Parking Â£25 per night - sounds alot, but not too bad for close to central London.

Reviews.Title: “noise noise noise”
Reviews.Author: bobby161
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel if you want peace and quiet. The noise is not from the road or surrounding area but from the back of the hotel. I had the misfortune to stay in one of the rooms at the back and had to endure the noise created by endless deliveries, rubbish collections etc. Not only did this take place during normal office hrs but also at 10.30pm and at 5am in the morning!! and then at 6am!! The noise from the trucks reversing in/out and keeping the engine running was infernal. As was the infuriating noise of metal trolleys being wheeled back and forth at all hours. Not to mention the loud banter of the drivers and staff at the hotel at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Average Brand name hotel- good location.”
Reviews.Author: GLCM87
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at avrious London Hotels for business and this is probably one of the poorer ones. Having said that it is ok, both the exterior and interior are fairly dated but clean. The hotel is in a great location, just across the road from Hyde Park and you can walk to Notting Hill and Portobello Market (about a 10-15 minute walk away) and even into Kensington and the high street (about a 20-25 minute walk away) The rooms were clean but nothing special, furniture and decor was a bit tired as well. Tea and Coffee in the room as well as bottled water free of charge, a big plus. Breakfast is fairly good, quite a lot of choice, hot and cold buffet. You could probably find other hotels that may be a bit cheaper for the same standard but if you get a good rate and you want a good base for exploring the City then it's a good bet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms but poor service”
Reviews.Author: AmyKinPhX
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in an Executive Double room for five nights and found the room (which overlooked Kensington Palace) to be clean and comfortable. I wish there was a dresser or chest of drawers so we didn't have to live out of the one drawer and our suitcases but that was our only complaint with the room. The location is fantastic for two underground lines, public buses and the bus tours. We walked to Hyde Park and some great restaurants in the area (like the Swan). There was a laundromat (laundrette) within three blocks of the hotel which was also convenient. It seemed like they were training all new staff who were not that friendly. I asked three times for an extra towel, which I never got. I got wrong information on the bus fare, and two of the clerks didn't know where the local laundromat was and sent me on some random directions. The wait staff for breakfast (which we bought as part of our stay) was rude and slow, and the bartender was unfriendly and seemed bothered by our business. Stay there for the location, not for the people.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in good location!”
Reviews.Author: siobhan2008uk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights - originally booked a standard double room but on check in I was told we had been upgraded to an executive room! Room was on the top floor and away from the main road so was very quiet. Room was very spacious and clean. Room had everything we needed e,g iron, iron board, kettle, hair dryer etc. Bathroom was spotless and had nice toiletries that were replaced daily by the maids - the only bad point was that the shower wasn't very powerful. Room was cleaned every day and the maids left fresh bottles of water,tea, coffee etc. Bed was very comfortable, the air con was great as the room was quite warm. The hotel is only a couple of minutes walk from Queensway tube station and about a 5 minute walk to Bayswater tube station. It is also right across the road from Kensington Gardens. Loads of shops/bars/restaurants nearby so is a great location. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Alexander-Holdgate's
Reviews.Content: Within a five minute walk to Notting Hill and just across the road from Hyde Park and Kensington Palace a great location for a tourist only to be enhanced with the Citie's two sightseeing tour bus' stopping right outside. We found all staff to be very friendly and helpful, giving advice on where to go and how to get there. The rooms were very spacious and clean. We founf it ideal for a family as we had a kingsize ben, travel cot (provided by hotel) and single bed put up in the room. This housed two adults a three year old and ten month baby. We were located at the front of the hotel over looking Hyde Park and must say weas noy bothered at all by the traffic on the Bayswater Road. We did find our room very hot though in the night despite of the air conditioning. Although only a five to ten minute bus ride to Marble Arch and having the benefit of that area, of an evening there was enough places to eat and drink round the corner from the hotel itself to enjoy and experience the hustle and bustle of London life, very handy when travelling with children. We felt safe at all times. Parking was Â£25 a night, but average for London and car was safe. Would definitley dtay there again and enjoyed the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fab trip to London - looking forward to do it again”
Reviews.Author: CAGS293
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my hubby on Monday. Right opposite Hyde Park and bus stop on doorstep with regular buses to West End. Two minutes from Queensway tub station. Lovely reception staff (checked in within a minute or two and very helpful with directions, maps etc) The room was at the rear, so rather peaceful. Clean room and bathroom. Breakfast: staff were welcoming and pleasant with lots to choose from and very tasty, got a big pot of fresh tea. Would definately stay again given the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay! Great location!”
Reviews.Author: FrancescandSonia
Reviews.Content: We had never been to Queensway area before and we always tried to book some place in Bloomsbury. This time, however, prices were so high that we were forced to move somewhere else and we ended up in the Ramada Hyde Park. Its location is excellent: walking distance from Notting Hill and only a few bus stops to Oxford Street and Tottenham Court Road. There are also buses to Camden and Victoria and it is very close to Notting Hill Gate, Queensway and Bayswater tube stations. Queensway itself has a lot of Restaurants, pubs and shops. Our room was a standard double, good size, extremely clean and with nice views to the victorian houses behind the hotel. In fact, it was the brightest room we ever had in any hotel, with an enormous window (it was one of the 4 walls actually). Our double bed was very comfortable and we had a big long mirror and a decent size flat screen, To sum up, great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean, tidy and nice room”
Reviews.Author: Natdon84
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely time, staff friendly, room clean and very comfy bed. Ideal location for sight seeing. Will be returning next year for another weekend away. Wouldn't want to be disappointed going somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff, Hotel overall clean but tired around edges”
Reviews.Author: OccassionalTourist
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked our stay through Late rooms.com and paid Â£98 per room excluding breakfast, overall the value was good, the rooms were clean and tidy, however they were a little tired around the edges and some general repairs were needed. We travelled with our daughter and her friend both aged 10 for a one night stay to give them both their first taste of London, for that you coulds not choose a better location only five mins by taxi to Marble Arch and within 2 mins walk of Queensway tube. Breakfast was of buffest style, plenty to eat and would cater for most tastes.. If you want to find a reasonable place to stay then this is a great find if you get the rooms at the right price, if however you are seeking a top notch 4 **** then there are others that provide better, Don`t get me wrong we would use this hotel again but if anyone from the hotels senior management are reading this review please by attention to the overall state of repair of the hotel, for it would not take a lot to bring this back to being a first class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay at the Ramada Jarvis Hyde Park”
Reviews.Author: Purdo
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself stayed at the Ramada in July for 3 nights before our trip to Egypt. . We used the tube at Queensway approx 3-4 minutes walk, which is on the central line and only a couple of stops from Marble Arch & Bond Street, so we found the hotel very central. There is a bus stop outside the hotel and all the London Tour buses stop there. It is a lovely area to go for a walk in the evenings, with Kensington Gardens directly across the road from the hotel, we cut through the Gardens on numerous occasions to walk to different surrounding areas. We found the hotel itself to be very clean, with T.V., tea/coffee making facilities, iron & ironing board, hairdryer, extra pillows. Booking in/out was quick and efficient. We took a taxi to and from Paddington Station which is less than a mile from the hotel to get to and back from Heathrow airport as we didn't fancy hauling the luggage up & down the steps at the tube stations. We asked Reception to book us a taxi on the morning we were leaving, they said they would hail one when we booked out as it would only take a couple of minutes to one. They were right, the Receptionist went outside and within a minute or two we were in the taxi. Breakfast was excellent with a good range of food to choose from. We didn't eat at the hotel apart from Breakfast, so cannot comment on lunch, dinner. Overall, I would definitely stay at the Ramada Jarvis Hyde Park again when I visit London again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: towelobsessive
Reviews.Content: This was long weekend break booked using Tesco Clubcard vouchers. Decided to book two rooms one for the teens, who are pretty independant at 17 and 14 and one for us. Phoned to book initially through Ramada's Central Reservations number. I would have liked adjoining rooms, one twin for the boys and one double for the grown ups, but was advised adjoining rooms weren't possible but would book rooms next to each other. The advisor confirmed that he had allocated the rooms while I was on the phone and all seemed to go smoothly, with follow up emails etc. Different story when we arrived, as rooms hadn'nt been booked (despite the fact we'd paid in advance) and they only rooms they had were on different floors. We were really annoyed as this was one of the reasons I booked with this hotel, but they said they didn't have any rooms together as they were pretty full that weekend. When shown the rooms the twin was very disappointing, and run down with old scratched wooden furniture and had a grubby feel about it. Back to reception to complain and another room was found. To her credit the receptionist was sympathetic and took us to show us another room to see if it was ok, which it was, although still on another floor to our room. This was really inconvenient as alot of stuff was packed together so we were up and down floors to take things from one room to another. On the whole however the Hotel was quite nice. The location was good, as others have said, although the lift at Queensway station was a bit of a bind as only one was ever working. Breakfast was good and beds very comfortable. Cleaning staff were vewry keen as they kept trying to clean the rooms before we had gone out. On the Sunday, on which the hotel advertise breakfast as lazy breakfast served until 12.00pm, one of the staff burst into our room at about 7.45 when she didn't get an answer after knocking on our door, because we were asleep! Whiteley shopping centre just down the road was quite good and there was a Spar shop very close by. I wouldn't go out of my way to stay there again, but it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and full of tour groups”
Reviews.Author: mrfalafel
Reviews.Content: One side of the hotel faces a noisy busy street the other side faces the service area where trucks rumble in at 8am and the halls and common ares are full of noisy tour group children and parents shouting at 8am on a Sunday. The bar charges Â£4.40 for a pint of draft beer and breakfast is Â£15.50. Outrageous. The 'free wifi' in the lobby is just about worthless as there is almost no signal to pick up. The location is in a heavily touristy area by Queensway tube station, local shops are nothing but tat souveniers and rubbish restaurants and hordes of tourists from the continent. There are much better parts of London to stay in. On the plus side the hotel room was quite large by London standards and there is a covered terrace out front for smokers and the staff are quite friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Professor0722
Reviews.Content: If you understand some basics about travel you will love this hotel. I read some unpleasant reviews before I booked. But I realized those folks were not travelers and did not understand how to get things done. We had no problems with booking, check-in, our stay, nor check-out. The hotel is in a great location for public transportation anywhere in London. There are plenty of shops and restaraunts within a five to 10 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel! Couldn't ask for more!!”
Reviews.Author: AlistairFin
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel just after 2pm. Room was already available but we got a free upgrade to the sky studios excecutive suite! Hotel very clean and lovely lobby and rooms. Hotel staff were so friendly and helpful, they really couldn't do enough for you. Hotel room was fantastic, air conditioned, widecreen TV's, good shower and bath, bed was so comfy! View was amazing of Kensington Gardens and you could see the London Eye in the distance. Breakfast was lovely, again staff very friendly. Did dine in the resutrant for one night and I cannot fault the food! The food was seriosuly 5* however the price is rather steep but they do 3 course set menu for Â£22. Parking however is charged by the hotel for Â£25 per night, however, just across the road from the front of the hotel is an NCP carpark where you can park for 24 hours at Â£15 (Just a little heads up for anyone staying!) Overall, had a fantastic stay, went for my girlfriends birthday as we went to see Wicked the musical, and the hotel made the trip that extra bit special.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: dart22
Reviews.Content: The Ramada Hyde Park is a basic 4 star hotel, perfect for business or if you're travelling and not intending to spend much time in the hotel. Rooms are modern. Bed was comfortable. Climate control in summer time is always a plus. A good nights sleep. It's a clean hotel. There were no faults with the buffet breakfast. The location is brilliant, short walk to Nottinghill Gate tube station, which is in Zone 1, where three tube lines meet. So any complaint about the location are naiive. Very good value for money. It was the first time I've stayed in a Ramada, and compared to the 4 star Hiltons I previously stayed in, in London, the Ramada is certainly a much better choice. I'll stay here again in future.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jobo565
Reviews.Content: Hotel was lovely, great location, staff great and helpfull. Rooms lovely, breakfast really nice was very suprised, would definately reccomend and go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Lollypop677
Reviews.Content: Just got back from London yesterday and I can honestly say what a wonderful experience my mum and I had. After reading some of the reviews on here about the hotel I was more than nervous about staying at the Ramada but to my surprise The hotel was clean, modern and very comfortable. The room was quite big with plenty of room for everything, the on suit was clean and a normal size. The decor was very clean and simple and the beds were extremely comfortable. The staff were very very helpful and never made us feel like we were being any trouble. We had the full English breakfast that came included in our holiday deal and it was really lovely. There was a lot of choice and we were seated by the window each morning which was nice as we got to watch London come to life. What I loved about this hotel was it was very down to earth but with a high standard that was maintained throughout our three day stay. It's location was great with a central tube station 5 mins away there was no problems with getting around. I would highly recommend staying here and I will defiantly be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small, Older Rooms, Service was OK”
Reviews.Author: danielles211
Reviews.Content: Our room was small especially for the location. We were close to a metro but not close to restaurants or the sights. The Queensway area was close with restaurants but I wouldn't go there at night. Hyde park was across the street and great for a walk. The hotel service was good, they did have free Wifi in the lobby but not in the room, it was pretty pricey for the room. The TV didn't have very many stations either. Breakfast was bland, it left a lot to be desired. There weren't a lot of plugs in the room to charge anything, we only found one to use. The concierge was great and very helpful! If I went back I would still try to find a better value.

Reviews.Title: “Budget travel for long trips to London”
Reviews.Author: OttawaCat314
Reviews.Content: First off, the location is great. It overlooks Hype Park and is very close to the Tube. We took a 2 week trip to London, and as you know, London isn't cheap, so we opted for a bargain basement hotel so we have have more money for other things. The rooms are basic and clean, the bathrooms are pretty big for a European hotel, the front desk staff was polite. The rooms all had coffee and cookies in it(which was nice), and it really was a basic hotel with basic amenities. The best part really though, was the price and the location. Its a place to sleep at night, but if you are here on a honeymoon or other romantic trip, I would not recommend it. Its really more a place for backpackers or students on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Find somewhere else to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ldaddy
Reviews.Content: The staff was less fluent in English than were the staff in the Paris hotel that we stayed. They were curt, abrupt, and did not seem interested in addressing our concerns. Additionally, I have never stayed at ANY HOTEL where the staff could not tell you the names of the cross streets of the hotel. They were painting the ceiling of the lobby all weekend when we arrived. Paint dripped on several articles of our clothing. We were told that there were signs about the paint and it was our fault. Problem was, we could not get to the room with out going by where they were painting (no other entrance). It was the painter who told us where local restaurants and shopping were located!!

Reviews.Title: “horrible staff and rooms”
Reviews.Author: thisisrocky
Reviews.Content: We were booked at this hotel through Globus/Monograms. The rooms are dirty and horrible. The staff, most of whom do not speak or understand ANY English (and this is England) are surly and rude. We had our room moved three times, but all were not good. Globus/Monograms was a complete waste of money. They promised a concierge on call 24/7 and the concierges for Globus only had hours from 8 am - 9 am and if one did not book one of their tours - they didn't even speak to the paying guests. All weekend long the lobby was being painted and there were only two drop clothes. When paint fell from the ceiling and ruined my husband's new shoes and my purse, the management said it was our fault because there were signs. The ONLY way to our room was through the painted walkway and picking our way through still did not prevent paint from falling from the ceiling.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Break”
Reviews.Author: Travelbunnydevon
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from 2 night stay at this hotel. Excellent location almost directly opposite Kensington Gardens with only short walk to Queensway Tube and bus stop nearby. Lovely area and good base for London - walking distance for visiting places like museums, Kensington Palace, Royal Albert Hall, shopping etc. Nice, clean, modern hotel. Buffet breakfast OK'ish but have had better. Usual overpriced drinks in bar etc. However, not a problem as plenty of other places to go in vicinity. Would definitely recommend for weekend in London.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, great location, outstanding customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Cumbrianguy
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for three nights with a family member at the beginning of April 2010. I was very impressed by the quality of the service and the food. The breakfast staff are a joy and look after people really well. The reception staff are very friendly and helpful. The room was great and the location of the hotel is also very good. It was simple to get in and out of central London from tube stations that were only a few minute's walk away. It was also excellent value for money. Highly recommended! Wonderful to find a place like this so close to central London.

Reviews.Title: “very nice room,good location,good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ltaltul
Reviews.Content: The room was comfortable,large bed,very clean. Great breakfast, good location- there's tube station very close to the hotel. The area is also very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CharmaineGloucester
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights in November, really nice hotel, lovely decorated ,clean rooms with coffee ad tea making fac, cable t.v , wifi ect, The bed was so comfortable i diddnt ever want to get out of it, Breakfast was really good too and had plenty to choose from Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “perfect for what we used it for”
Reviews.Author: micklees1
Reviews.Content: had booked with a theatre break company to see Jersey boys for my mum and my friend 92 and 85 for xmas /birthday treat.. arrived about 1pm 1 room was ready so we all had tea then went to matinee .other Room was ready when we returned and was very clean, modern and what i would expect from a 4 star. there was enough tea supplies and toiletries for our one night stay . I asked for more milk at night and was quickly given a jug full from the reception.check in was quick and all staff were very helpful with taxis directions etc. We came back to dinner in the restaurant and that was excellent and reasonably priced. someone mentioned in a review the place was tired and shabby. Yes it was not all new and shiny but the Carpet they mentioned looked drab because it was grey/lime/black stripe and would have looked the same if it was brand new i think .more a design fault than a cleanliness issue.It did the job comfortable beds fresh Linen /Towels what more do you need for a one night stay?

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location but dingy, dated rooms”
Reviews.Author: finnkjer
Reviews.Content: Lift didnt work for the whole 4 days we were there. Paid Â£70 per room per night. Staff were friendly and welcoming but not reccomended hotel at all

Reviews.Title: “the rooms were more of a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Nadine8282
Reviews.Content: i had two bookings in the Ramada hyde park earlier this month i had first booked a smoking room thinking it really wouldnt make a difference to me the non smoker only to find out that the rooms werent well insulated and i could smell smoke from the next room. the size of the room was so small even for a solo traveler, providing no clear space for the baggages hence you get a feeling the room is so crowded and everything is just so in the way. the bath room would really use a renovation especially the bath tub and the shower head which was very inconvenient to use. the real disappointment was the air handling system in the room the thermostat was not working and apperantly it only functioned as an ac that even when the ac was turned off at one night i could really feel the room was freezing. on the bright side the breakfast was a delight , the location of the hotel is very convenient and a short walk for queensway tube station and the staff are polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Faded glory”
Reviews.Author: Hop3fullyL0st
Reviews.Content: This Ramada has clearly past its use-by date and is fading into the past. We were lucky enough to be on the "mezannine" floor overlooking the loading dock. This meant an early wake up with the bins being emptied as the staff had a loud and abrasive disagreement right below our window. The rooms were obviously once quite plush, but show their age badly. Breakfast was a meal to be endured not enjoyed. In a room heated more than the food, a 16 pound breakfast (or 64 pounds for our family of 4) was outrageous. Thankfully the wait staff were both friendly and efficient, otherwise it would have been unbearable. My final gripe - internet access. In a city where free wifi is almost a standard, 5 pounds per hour (or 10 pounds per day) for a cable (and a short cable at that) connection is complete rubbish.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great location, good size rooms, free breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Jenna077
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Ramada Hyde Park. The location was great for siteseeing as you only need to take one tube from most places in the city. The room was clean and overlooked Kensington Gardens. Close to a great little bar in Nottinghill, Oxford St, Picadilly and Hyde Park. Would definetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “An OK hotel in a fairly good location”
Reviews.Author: Travelagent036
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in a bind to find a hotel for 1 night when most hotels were fully booked. We found a room at the Ramada for 188 GBP incl VAT but w/o breakfast whereas a Hilton wanted 309 GBP + VAT. Room with King bed was very small, but clean and very comfortable. Nice flat screen TV. Bathroom was very, very small with tub/shower combo. Carpets thruout the hotel needed replacing or steam cleaning at least. Location is close to Queensway Underground. Several very nice and moderately priced restaurants just 5 minutes away on Bayswater Road. Staff at hotel was friendly and attentive. If this hotel were priced at less than 100 GBP I would give it really good marks, but 188 GBP was just too much,

Reviews.Title: “Good location, a little tlc required”
Reviews.Author: Breadsticks
Reviews.Content: Located close to Queensway tube, very convenient and across from the park which is more than pleasant. Check-in was swift. Room was compact, bathroom rather small. All a little tired around the edges really. Not very effective solution was offered to internet connection within the room not working - 'There's an internet cafe along the road'. Disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressed”
Reviews.Author: ScarolineUK
Reviews.Content: Really disappointed in this hotel - room was dark and dingy - there was a hair in the bath from the previous guest and when i called the reception they didnt really give a damn - in desperate need of modernisation i thought i was in a time warp when i walked into the room and beds itchy. Not good. My boyfriend booked this hotel for a suprise theatre weekend and chose it because it is a 4 star. It really should be a 3 star. Oh and breakfast wasnt good either. Wouldnt recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel,good location,”
Reviews.Author: chillchillchill
Reviews.Content: We parked the car in hotel car park very handy.Comfortable ,well stocked room.Breakfast good on first morning but second morning ran out of bacon.All in all good value.

Reviews.Title: “great location and good service.”
Reviews.Author: mumford
Reviews.Content: staying on business I found the Queensway tube 5minutes from the hotel excellent for getting around town. Hyde Park across the street was nice for a stroll before or after work. Double room was as you would expect at this level. Room was made up each day. Conceige available for information and checking luggage prior to room availability at 2pm. Breakfast was help yourself all you can eat buffet with cooked or continental, your choice. Staff were attentive and helpful. Bar opens onto patio on Bayswater Road for people watching. Conference rooms available and catered. I found it a good base for meeting clients and for travelling to clients in central London day pass GBP5.60

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are So-So, but Location Makes it Easy to Sightsee”
Reviews.Author: One4travel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is across the street from Hyde Park and it is near the Tube station, making sightseeing easy to do on your own. The Original Tour Bus stops at the hotel, for those who want to use it. The rooms are dated, small, and nothing to write home about, but sufficient if you are only staying a night or two. The bed was comfortable enough and the pillows were excellent. Tolietries were limited to shampoo, bath gel and a shower cap. Complimentary water and a tea/coffee tray were provided in the room. Breakfast in the hotel's restaurant was above average with good coffee. Hotel and restaurant staff varied from excellent to brusque. Ask for a room on the side or the back of the hotel on a high floor to avoid traffic noise in the street-facing rooms. The hotel was evacuated due to a fire alarm in the wee hours one morning during our stay. We saw many different styles of pj's on many various body types as we waited in the street for the firemen to check out the entire building. A short ten-minute walk from the hotel takes you to the Windsor Castle Pub, which is a great place for supper and drinks. We had delicious bangers and mash in this historic pub that is home to London's finest beer garden.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice breakfast, quiet room, and real air conditioning!”
Reviews.Author: bigbadjc
Reviews.Content: Having stayed there before a few years ago, we went back for the air conditioning in July and the superb location. The first room had a problem with the AC, so they gave us a fan for the night and put us in another room the next day. They handled all the moving. The people at the desk were always pleasant and helpful. The room is a normal size for a European hotel and was nicely decorated and well kept. The beds were very comfortable. We booked on a special rate well in advance and ended up paying only about $140 a night, an incredible bargain for London in the summer. I would stay in the Ramada again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Frankie2102
Reviews.Content: Hyde Park Ramada is in a perfect spot opposite Hyde Park and in a great area for numerous restaurants and cafes. I can highly recommend the Persian Restaurant a few minutes walk away. The underground station stop is approx 5 minutes away on the circle line. The staff at the Ramada were friendly, polite, helpful and professional and the room was great. We were located on the 5th floor with a view towards the park. The room was spacious with tea/coffee making facilities, iron and ironing board - everything you could need. The bathroom had both a bath and shower and was spacious, the bed was comfortable. Probably the best thing was the room had air conditioning which we could set ourselves, which was great as London was particularly hot on the day we stayed. I would highly recommend the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special, but okay”
Reviews.Author: FinlandJohanna
Reviews.Content: The standard room is an average, but good-sized business-like hotel room, the bed was very comfortable and air-conditioning and bath tub a plus, however, there was no safety-deposit box in the room and the valuables were to be kept in the reception and in return, one would get a key which was not very convenient. The menue and service at the restaurant left to be desired. Location was very good right next to Hyde Park and two subway stations. Staff was friendly. The hallways were in need for renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot for a cultural stay”
Reviews.Author: TonyStafford
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally situated for Buckingham and Kensington palaces and parks. Also, The Royal Albert Hall (well worth a visit at Â£7.00) and various other museums are within walking distance across Kensington park. Bus stops (national bus passes can be used, also 'Oyster' cards are ideal for the U-ground+ buses) are located within 50m of the hotel. U/G stations about 150m away. There are loads of good cafes and snack places nearby, especially if you want an early morning breakfast! The hotel staff were excellent, very attentive, especially in the restaurant. Nothing was too much trouble. We only had one evening meal, but the service and quality of food was excellent. There are no leisure facilities, but who needs them when you the whole of London to entertain you. The rooms were good and clean, although some refurbishment is due! The bathroom facilities were clean and in working order, but past their sell-by date. The ceilings could do with a coat of paint. The room fittings, the TV and bed linen were brilliant. The only negative point was the taxi departure. We told to book a taxi 5mins before our departure. This didn't happen as there was no member of staff available. So don't bother. The easy and cheap way is to go to the main road and flag a cab.There are plenty of them and it cost Â£10. to Euston station. We would certainly use this hotel again. Tony And Claire.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable visit”
Reviews.Author: AnnieL64
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night with my 11 year old daughter so we could do some sightseeing in London. Hotel about 5 mins walk from Queensway tube, we were able to leave our case, as we arrived before check in, then go off and explore. Lovely location opposite Kensington Gardens, where we had an stroll the next morning. Our room was plenty bit enough for 2, comfy beds, kettle, hairdryer, Bathroom fine, lovely shower. It overlooked Bayswater road, and yes, you could hear the traffic humming, but you also got a view of the gardens; you couldn't hear noise from any of the other rooms. I found the staff helpful, and the breakfast was great - something for everyone. There were loads of places to eat at night on Queensway and shops too. All in all, we enjoyed our stay (we booked through superbreak), and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Ramada”
Reviews.Author: loshell
Reviews.Content: From all of the reviews we were expecting a nice stay at the Ramada. Pros: - room size was good - comfortable bed Cons: - Breakfast. We were served burnt toast (white bread which was obvioulsy now black) and after getting over the surprise they thought it was acceptable to serve this we requested some edible toast. Five minutes later more toast arrives which was also burnt but they had used a knife to scrap off some of the black this time. - They only have two elevators to service the hotel and during our two day stay one of the elevators was out of service. This meant guests lined up for the lift and it could take 5-7 minutes to get to the front of the line to board the lift. Quicker to walk up 7 flights of stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Suave And Sophisticated 70s Style!”
Reviews.Author: allliemk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this large hotel when we went to the Blur gig in Hyde Park, which is opposite the hotel. It was a brilliantly hot and sunny day, and we checked in immediately and were given a 'skyline' room, which started me thinking along the Jetsons theme! The room was large, with a panoramic view of Hyde Park and a mysterious but grand building opposite, albeit with the busy Bayswater Road running in between the park and the hotel. The windows opened, sacrily enough, with a sheer drop down about 8 floors - gulp! We couldn't really work out the air-con - but not sure if this was our fault or the slightly ambiguous instructions! The room had a real 1970s feel about it, but was spotlessly clean and very large - although the bathroom in contrast was very small! When we returned from the gig we had a couple of drinks in the bar, which was buzzing even nearing midnight. Expensive, but to be expected in a central London hotel. The swoosh of night traffic I found rather soothing when we got to bed, but may irritate others I guess. Breakfast the next morning was super-busy, most people taking the late option and taking their time to plough through the excellent selection, which included cereals, breads, and a full English including yummy (!) black pudding, which pleased my partner! A good clean hotel, perhaps lacking charm and a bit like a private hospital, but does the job.

Reviews.Title: “Across the street to Hyde Park”
Reviews.Author: Armenia
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Ramada for 3 nights. I did my reservation couple of month in advance and fixed price which should be considered as value for money (105 pounds). The hotel locaion is convenient for relaxing activities in Hyde Park as well as for exploring London. Right accross the street is Hyde Park with al the recreation areas that may expect: childrens playground, lake, etc. For tLondon explorers Ramada's location also good: the closest tume/mtro station in 3 minutes walking distance and the bus station is right in the front of hotel. My first impression while I was walking in the hall to my room was the hotel is little outdated. However, the room was good enough, clean and big enough. For internet users: please be advised that you may have wired internet acess only for around 11.99 pounds/24 hours. Alternatively, the cost of hourly internet connection something like 5.99 pounds. The hotel is located right on the Bayswater road. So, it may be noisy when your room windows are facing this road. Overall reccomendation: you may expect reasonable 3-4 star service in a location close to public transportation and huge Hyde park.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Great Value”
Reviews.Author: WooWoo74
Reviews.Content: Just back from a weekend in London and was delighted with the Ramada Hyde Park. Its location is wonderful and transport links great. Bus right outside door to Oxford Street and the other way to Westfield Shopping Centre. Just across the road is the entrance to Kensington Gardens. The room was a really decent size and it was really quiet to the rear of the hotel, you would not know you were in central London. Breakfast was good and staff were very helpful. Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great , hotel good.”
Reviews.Author: JohnMSweden
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights and found the hotel very good located and for our purposes and needs adequate. The room was located towards Bayswater Road but on the fifth floor so we had no problems sleeping despite of the traffic. Very good beds. The breakfast was ok but not fantastic. We payed 512 GBP for four nights incl. english breakfast and I think we got value for the money but paying a higher price would not be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay with Good Service”
Reviews.Author: DownBoy
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel to a be perfectly situated base for touring London. Staff were very friendly and helpful, advising us of the best times to avoid the rush at breakfast. The breakfasts were very good and especially the speed at which the staff turned the tables around to seat the next guests. Only down side was the fire alarm went off at 3:30am on the last night of our stay but this seemed to be no fault of the hotel. Would highly recommend this hotel if it can be got at the right price - we found the best price to be on the hotel's own website.

Reviews.Title: “A good option in London, if the price is right”
Reviews.Author: CRobDerbyshire
Reviews.Content: I chose the Ramada Hyde Park as one of my favourite London hotels from a few years back, when they offered good deals. It has since become a more expensive option, but I recently found an attractive offer through booking.com of Â£55 per night for a single room. The hotel is a modern white building, nicely located opposite Hyde Park on the long Bayswater Road, between Notting Hill and the Marble Arch end of Oxford Street. It is within walking distance of the Notting Hill shops and public transport is close at hand, with a bus stop virtually outside the hotel and the Queensway tube station only a couple of minutes walk away. The reception area is nice and spacious, and I found the check-in staff to be pleasant and efficient. However, on the way to my room, I felt the corridors looked dated and tired, in much need of decoration. My room was on a side street, away from the busy Bayswater Road. It was therefore a relatively quiet room and had a large wall-to-wall window, which let in a fair amount of light. Although a single room (and therefore small), the bed was wider than a normal single. I found the furnishings to be quite tasteful and pleasing, but again the decor was in need of freshening up, with torn/peeling wallpaper in evidence. A generously-sized LCD TV was provided, and a nice touch was complimentary bottles of still and sparkling water. The ensuite bathroom included a full-size bath with shower over. The bath wasn't very inviting, being slightly grimy, particularly at the shower end. However, I was impressed by the powerful shower which provided ample hot water. Breakfast wasn't included in my room rate, but was available for Â£10 if booked at least a day in advance, or Â£15 if you turned up without booking. I didn't take the breakfast. The check-out time for this hotel is 12 noon, which is very convenient for those guests who don't need to leave early. The Ramada Hyde Park remains a very good option in central London, although does require some cosmetic updating. At the rate I paid, it was certainly a bargain, although I wouldn't be so happy to pay the full rate. Given suitable offers, it is a hotel I will probably return to again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...nice location”
Reviews.Author: jimjam76
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night as a little weekend break . Excellent rate , room was nice size for London , great view of Hyde Park and a few smoking rooms available which is always nice as there are someof us who still smoke ! Ideal location right near loads of places to eat on Queensway and 3 tube stations withing 5 mins walk ! Nice little hotel ! Breakfast could have been better but you win some you lose some !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for location”
Reviews.Author: Morrdela
Reviews.Content: Just back from a three night stay at Ramada, Hyde Park. This hotel was excellent value for money and very conveniently loated. Queensway tube station is only 3-4 miutes walk away. A 20 minute walk will bring you to Oxford street and Hyde Park is just across the road from the hotel. The staff were helpful and pleasant. I'm not sure that it is 4star standard but all I wanted was a clean comfortable room with a good shower. I got all of these. Breakfast was not included in the price (Â£85 per room) but there was a nice little cafe nearby that did a lovely breakfast. This is not a luxurious, plush hotel but it certainly does not deserve the bad reviews it has received in my opinion

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for a short stay.”
Reviews.Author: tabesugi
Reviews.Content: The best feature of this hotel is the location. Itâ€™s a short walk from Queensway tube and from there, a short hop into the West End. There are also numerous restaurants and shops around the station. The hotel is situated on the main road so if youâ€™re a light sleeper, you might want to request a room at the back. The room was a decent size by London standards although lacking some facilities I would expect in this range, most notably a refrigerator. Bedding and towels looked a bit worn and could have used a more thorough cleaning. My biggest gripe is with the shower; the water temperature was lukewarm and the pressure was little more than a trickle. Breakfast was very good with a nice selection of hot dishes although I felt a bit rushed by the staff over-zealously clearing the table, and there were only two other guests in the restaurant at the time. Overall itâ€™s probably adequate for an overnight shopping or theater trip, but Iâ€™m not sure Iâ€™d recommend it for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “3 Star not 4...”
Reviews.Author: UkSwiss
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for business, even though they recently increased their rates.When checking in a asked for a non noisy postion which I got the opposite off, and was kept awake all night until 3pm with cars driving through road works area at the front of the hotel. Not to emntion the paper thin waqlls, so could hear next doors tv and every noise. As if I wasn't unhappy enough, then in the morning the shower was broken and didn't work. One positive comment is that the staff were welcoming enough, and semed to be trying, although none spoke full english and all were foreign as usual in the UK these days. Pick a cheaper B and B or 3 star hotel in a less noisey are of possible.

Reviews.Title: “Worth exactly the price”
Reviews.Author: pelena
Reviews.Content: I dreaded going to Ramada after reading some of comments here, but in reality things don't look that bad there - in fact, it's quite a normal hotel, considering its price (for me it was 45 pounds, inlc. taxes). But you get exactly what you pay for - a typical room with needed amenteties, but nothing more than that. I can't find anything terrible to say, however the hotel is nothing special none-the-less. So if you're looking for a cheap place to stay, it should be fine for you - friendly staff, you'll get a nice bed, a nice bathroom, a TV set and a tea set even with free cookies. But you can't expect miracles or superb service for 45 pounds per night, can you? However if you have extra money, there're definitely better hotels in London. But if you're stuck to your budget, Ramada will do.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel, good for short stay”
Reviews.Author: Noogles
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel was ok, but in need of tidying up. The location is good, I got off at Queensway but Nottinghill Gate is also a short walk away. The hotel was really easy to get to, and can't be missed, which is great as I forgot to take my directions with me! Reception was lovely, check in was a bit slow but the person who dealt with me was a trainee and the computer system was playing up, so I don't think that could've been helped. That said, the receptionist was lovely, and a great representative for the hotel. The room itself was a decent size; I requested a single room and got one with 2 single beds. The en suite was a little small, but for one one person it was adequate. The only issue I had was that the bathroom really needed a make over; at first I thought the bath was dirty, but realised that it was actually old and a bit shabby and rusty. I didn't use the restaurant, as there was a variety of restaurants around the corner. Overall, I think the hotel was good for the purpose that I needed. I probably wouldn't recommend it for an extended stay though.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even think about staying here, you will regret it!”
Reviews.Author: AndreBR
Reviews.Content: I travel for business and I ended up staying at the Ramada Hyde Park for 4 nights. It was the worst mistake I have made in quite some time. This hotel is a disgrace, it is not a 3 or 4 star, more like 2, and dirty! I disliked my stay here so much so that I will never stay in a Ramada associated hotel again. The single rooms are tiny! ugly! dirty! and the walls are thin as paper so you can hear everyone around you. The hallways are so badly deteriorated that it looks as if a war ravaged the walls. To top it off, they have no hotel amenities, no gym, no business center, etc.. The only thing positive I can say is the staff is nice but incompetent.
